Update for v0.6Game remains unplayable. Bugs that have persisted for 4 years now have not been addressed and show no sign that the dev team have the ability to resolve them and bring this game to a state where it will be a playable *game*Since purchasing this game I have discovered that the foundering team were two graphics designers at university. So far it seems they haven't tauight themselves to program in any meaningful way, and all the programmers they hire seem to swiftly quit.It sadens me to discover that instead of working hard on fixing real problems with their game, they have spent a great deal of time and resouces adding cosmetic (useless)  enhancements for christmas and halloween, as well as amassing many fake reviews and other PR spin to try to fool others into donating more of their hard earnt dollars to their existing holiday fund that was around $700,000 from kickstarter, and a mininum of $300,000 from steam (yes, thats around $1 million dollars)Grade A scammers. You have been warned.SAVE YOUR MONEYDO NOT BUY THIS GAMEEvery wonder why this game has so many negative reviews but the forums are overwhelmingly positive?That's because this games developers activly delete negative forum posts and ban those post's authors in an effort to hide the fact that this game has not recieved any significant update with ingame improvements in over 3 years.Every year prior to the Christmas, for 3 years running now, Sauropod have released a series of fake updates to Castle Story to create the illusion of activity in hopes of cashing in on the Christmas season sales.You don't hear about it on the forums because everyone who comments about it gets swifly banned.Save your money, avoid this game at all costs.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								The first few hours of Castle Story seemed to scratch a castle-building itch I had been having. Seeing as this is an Early Access title, I was more than willing to endure the countless AI bugs that left my Bricktrons doing absolutely nothing and repeatedly ignoring my commands. I was determined to build and epic, sprawling citadel to defend against the oncoming waves of enemies. Sadly, it wasn't long before defending against the repetetive waves of identical, easily dispatched foes lost its charm. I could not fault Castle Story for its lack of content, it IS and Early Access game. So, I waited. A check of their website said they were "re-factoring" their code. This was indeed a lengthy process and five or so months later, they announced its completion and that regular updates would soon resume. I held out faith that after the "re-factoring" of their code, updates would come much more quickly. After all, this was what the developers told us. However, here we are now, several months later and they've wasted time and money to create a "Pause" feature and some Halloween content. The addition of Halloween content to this game was just adding insult to injury. I find it incredibly difficult to believe that after months and months of waiting, Suaropod has failed to create anything of substance which could be implemented, even it were in a buggy state. Abandon hope all ye who enter. Castle Story, is an empty, lifeless shell of what your hard earned money actually paid to see.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								I cannot say how angry I am right now.  I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!!!!!! Seriously, I want my money back.  The demo shows this cute little game where you circle areas of terrain and the little yellow dudes do what you say.  I bought this game, downloaded it, and started playing it.  It starts with a few dudes standing around a blue rock.  I click on one of them, they highlight with a little circle, I click on a tree, and they stop being highlighted and keep right on standing there.  After about ten minutes of increasing frustration, I finally succeed on getting two of them to cut down some trees. This causes one of them to fall off the world, and the other to quit working completely.  Meanwhile, I've been trying to get the others to build some sort of anything at all.  Highlighting an area of the ground causes a little square to appear and then disappear as soon as you let go of the button.  This causes the the little yellow dudes to continue standing around and do nothing.  This game is niether fun nor intuitive.  If I could give stars, I wouldn't give it any. I posted my review back in February 2014, it is now November of the same year, so I decided to give this game another try.  Literally nothing has changed or improved in any way.  The little yellow creatures still don't move (I got a message from the developer when I complained about it last time-- they said it was just because I couldn't figure out how to play the game) and there are no new maps.   Still can't reccommend this game, still want my money back.Update: September 2015.  I saw the update queue on my computer and decided to try the game again.  Bricktrons:  The bricktrons will now move, and will perform assigned tasks most of the time. They do have a strong tendency to freeze as their A.I. seems to lose track of what they are doing, but it is possible to build things, as long as there aren't more than 6 bricktrons on screen.  They get in each other's way very easily, and I have had to restart my game more than 4-5 times in a single gaming session due to freezes/crashes. Tutorial: I played the tutorial, and it did help me figure out the controls. However, I did run into problems where the menus simply wouldn't pop up, or if they did, it wasn't the menu I needed at the time.Conclusion: If this was the game I had downloaded almost 2 years ago, it wouldn't have been half bad, and I would have given it a positive review,  If the game continues to improve, I will switch my review to recommended.

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is the first time I have written a review so im going to just start out by talking about the game then I will get into a more pro/con format later in.I played castle story back when it was just out of the prototype stage and there were many problems. two of the biggest problems were the path finding of the units and the camera's controls, everything else was injoyable. I have taken over 2 year break from this game. After the break I have come back to islands (maps) that are 10x as big as the "first island", two new game modes conquest (capture the point) and invasion (wave survival), a normal camera control system and enemys that you have to defend against. To add on to all that devs are getting ready to launch a multiplayer update where we can share control with friends or battle against one another (but as thats not in yet I will keep that out of my mind for the rest of the review). The game mode conquest is not very injoyable to me but the invasion mode is very challenging but fun so I'm going to focus on invasion. In invasion you start out with a few workers, a knight, an archer and your crystal (homebase) so you stright away get to work setting jobs and delgating how many workers you want doing diffrent jobs such as chopping trees for wood, working the iron mines, working in your querry for stone to make bricks or building your stronghold. Now building is a little unique you have to build your structures one brick at a time (you can click and drag so its not tedious) which means you can end up with a stronghold that can take multiple hits of explosive barrels or one. You can make you stronghold tall or wide its up to you but you do have to make sure you put supports under your structures so that your building doesn't collapse on its self. So I would say that castle story is a game that has seen a lot of growth and is at a stat were its fun to play.Some pros and cons:Pros:very good lookingeasy to build structureschallenging to balance jobsvarying sizes of mapsterrain deformation/reformationyou can build any size or shape structurestress systemcamera is not unusable like early releasesdevs are always releasing updatesCons:takes large amounts of time to complete structresbig map has some framerate issuesnot all game modes on every mapbugs where enemys dont charge your basewhen builting unless you have two wide paths there may be some pathing issuesminor lighting bugsIf you have the money to spare I think castle story is a game you should pick up.

								The video to this game got me hooked early on. It wasn't long before I finally splashed out and began sinking many hours in to the game. content:
Posted: May 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								VERSION 0.6.4 REVIEW===Pros & Cons+ Pros ++ Very good mix of Sandbox, Tower Defence and Strategy that actually works+ You can build your very own fortress and defend it with an army+ Totally destructible / modifiable environment+ Added sandbox mode to build without worry of attacks+ Simple enough control system allows you to do what you need quickly+ AI has improved much since past versions and now can do complex tasks without errors+ Good building system / task system that doesn't make a mess of what is going on and keeps it clean+ Multiplayer has been improved and now works properly+ Good variety, for an Early Access, of parts and structures to build- Cons -- Camera system could be better- You still have to dig resources in sandbox mode, instead of having everything unlimited like a proper "creative" mode- Kinda poor variety of units to either build or to face in battle as enemies===Personal opinionCastle Story is surely a game with lots of potential, and still has time and quite a long way to be able to fully express the possibilities available to its gameplay. Still, it has improved a lot since the past versions, devs actually listened to the community on what should be done to improve the game, and did it.This mix of Defense, RTS and Sandbox can be found in very few other games i know of, and it's worth to give a try to anyone who likes building his own stuff and/or RTS in general.It can really be fun to defend your own castle, underground fortress or whatever you want to build against increasingly difficult enemies, think of it as a Stronghold mixed with Minecraft, pretty epic isn't it?I will update this review when updates come out, stay tuned.===ACTUAL RATING: 8/10

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								Very promising idea. Very poor execution. The UI tries to be minimalistic and fresh, but comes off as clunky and unintuitive. Spending most of my time trying to remember how to get it to do what I want is usually a bad sign. Anything you want to do is buried below at least two or three levels of menus. That's a big no-no for anyone who knows how to do a UI.The performance for a game like this minimal really shouldn't be bad, but it bogs down after only a few minutes. That makes it even more difficult to play.Even worse, the AI is frustratingly dumb. In a game like this, I would've fixed and polished that first, even if the UI wasn't ready. The little workers spend way too much time in a stupor when time is often of the essence. When they do work, it's often not very efficient. They can build themselves and others into a corner. Stockpiles can fill up with worthless junk while the vaulables sit untouched nearby. Often they fill up the nearest stockpile instead of the most full, giving you a bunch of half-full and unusable piles. One missed or misplaced block (or even one closed door) can render an entire castle useless.Just needs way more polish and actual listening to feedback. With the updates coming every few months and not really seeming to do much, I wouldn't hold out much hope. Avoid this and go buy something fun.

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
Early Access Review
								It's been a long time since I knew this game had potential, but Sauropod encountered problem in the first steps of the development. After 200h ingame, I stoped. I came back yesterday, and I have to say: this potential clearly became reality with the last patchs.   There are 4 main modes (for the moment): -Peace mode: build your own castle (tunnel and bridge) and expand it to a whole map in peace mode. Perfect to practice!!-Survival mode: try to survive as long as possible to the enemies waves. You'll have to smartly build your castle and defend it with your archers, knights, catapults and traps. (dificulties: easy, normal, hard)-Conquest mode: build multiple structure and try to expand your kingdom to capture enemie's base without being attacked in your main castle. (dificulties: easy, normal, hard)-Coop peace mode: build with your friends!There is also a map editor and a lot of new content upcoming.     Don't care about these old review pointing the bad optimisation, or saying this game is dead. They are wrong, castle story is alive, improving and WAITING FOR YOU SOLDIER! If you like strategic/construction/war game , this one is definitely for you!!!

content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I bought this game in February of 2014, and it has come a long, long way since that time. I remember buying a copy, and buying another copy for a friend of mine, and we both were very impressed with the functionality and gameplay straight off the bat. Early on, it was a little rough around the edges, but seeing as the devs are keeping it updated and adding more and more as time goes on, I have no doubt it will keep getting better and better. The multiplayer is pretty cool, fairly functional with a few small bugs, but I'm going to chalk those up to be the fact that my friend was hosting the server in Michigan and I was connecting from Arizona. The bugs I mentioned were buildings popping in and out of existance, Bricktrons popping in and out of existance (both of these item popping into and out of existance bugs reset after a server restart. Nothing ingame was lost.), and crashes occationally when my friend would stop the server. As of right now, 05,16,2016, the multiplayer gameplay is a little bland. There's not much to do other than try to make cool castles and watch as bricktrons dig their way into the ground, then eventually seal themselves in their own mines. There is no PVP combat yet with the warriors, but you can still lop arrows at your friend's worker bricktrons when he sends them over to your base to say hello. BUT, the devs Shatojon and Evax livestreamed a new work in progress update teaser with co-op corruptron combat and base building 3 days ago on 05,13,2016. I can't wait until they release it. I will update this review with my thoughts after I have explored the update, but my first impressions from seeing the livestream are very positive. A co-op bricktron combat alongside co-op base building is exactly what I wanted from this game.Overall, I am very pleased with my $20 investment. Some people tend to say that every hour of playtime should considered to be about a dollar, and if you come up short on hours spent playing, then it's a bad investment. I personally don't think that's a very good idea of how you should look at the picture. I see it as this: if the game is fun, then it's a good investment, if the game is bad, it's a bad investment. You'll never know if it's good or bad until you invest. Don't take my opinion as the gospel, nor should you take anyone else's opinion as the gospel, since we all have different opinions. If the game looks fun to you, invest, if you don't want to, don't. Just don't whine and moan when the game isn't perfect even though it says right above the "Add to cart" button that the game isn't perfect and that it is still in early access. Don't♥♥♥♥♥♥on the developers who are making this game for a living for not completing the game quick enough. They're taking their time to make the game as perfect as they want it to be, updating it and keeping in contact with the customers. Hell, the developer Shatojon even added me and sent me a message asking my opinion on the game. Has any AAA game developer gone out of their way to actually talk one on one with a customer before? Did Ubisoft go out of their way to ask their consumers' opinions on Assassin's Creed Unity after it was released broken? Nope. The only thing Ubisoft's CEO has said was that ALL Steam users and all PC users are pirates, and that he doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ if the game is broken for us.  Would you, the consumer, really rather have a broken game on release and a CEO of the company you're buying the content from telling you to get bent because he's an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, than a game functional in early access and a group of devs who really bust their asses with a game they want people to enjoy? Seriously?

								Can this be short?The fact is, I love this game. You may be thinking "Then why in the world are you not recommending it?". Here is the answer: This game lures you in with the concept of a fun sandbox with cute little creatures running around following your commands. The horrible truth is revealed when you are 1 hour in: You really should of spent that $20 on a pack of bacon. Yeah, a pack of bacon's fun lasts longer than this excuse of a game. The bricktons do not follow your commands, the building system is untrustable and takes a long time to even understand how to build a wall and they added a wave system with way too much time in between waves... But the reason I still like it is because the game is a great idea. The sandbox TD stratergy game is a great idea, but just not developed enough. If Sauropod wakes up and discovers that they created a mess of a game, and they fix it, we would have a good game.Well, so much for a short review.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								12/10/14 UPDATE: There's a new patch! Nope, nothing in the way of actual content...they've rewritten three major aspects of the game (graphics, AI and new voxel engine). REALLY?! After over two years of development, they're still rewriting the basics. If this doesn't say "STAY AWAY" to you, then nothing will. ORIGINAL REVIEW: This might be an awesome building/fight game in about eighteen years or so. I love building games, and as a result I get easily bamboozled by the promise of games like Castle Story -- take charge over a group of vaguely humanoid bipedal lumps named 'bricktons' and have them build castles and buildings and such, make weapons for them so that they can defend themselves against all manner of goblinry. There's gonna be mayhem and fighting and explosions with arrows and stuff flying everywhere. With catapults and everything.Unfortunately, as it stands right now, it's little more than a tech demo -- the UI is flaky, making it difficult to mine and build anything. The Bricktons tend to stand around more often than actually do work due to incomplete AI. Despite excellent graphics and animation, the game itself has a unique lack of polish to it -- it's tough to even know what to do in a logistics sense, and the UI makes doing it a struggle even when you've figured it out.What's worse is that Castle Story has been in development for an amazing length of time for it to be in such a state (just over two years at this point, and their kickstarter has been funded to the tune of $702k when they asked for just under $30k). As best as I can figure out, the development team had to rewrite vast sections of their game for some reason or another at some point last year (rumor has it to accommodate a Linux version, which is preposterous if it's true).However, their development blog of late has been more concerned about their going to PAX East and moving to a new office than trivialities such as the state of their game (and reading between the lines, it would seem as though their time at PAX didn't go so well...which is hardly a surprise given the state of the game currently).All-in-all, avoid Castle Story for now. Hopefully it's coming out in the next two years or so and I can change my recommendation. I play a LOT of early access games, and this one is frankly the second worst when it comes to time in development.

Early Access Review
								(TL;DR at bottom)I was looking at this game when it first came out on kickstarter - and bought game when it came out on steam because I thought it had such a great potential. It still does, believe me! Tho.. I've played it a bit back and fourth and have seen a couple of 200MB and 300MB updates but has there been any changes? Sadly, not that I've seen. The gameplay hasn't changed and the workers bugs out all the time and there's nothing you can do to prevent it. How are we supposed to test a game and give feedback when we can't even play the game properly?In multiplayer it's near impossible for someone else to connect to your server and when they manage to do so you can't even see what they are building and one of you randomly win because of god knows what.I had big hopes for this game but as of now I do not recommend this game to anyone.TL;DR: Do not buy this game, it might seem like the devs are updating the game but they aren't. There are tons of gamebreaking bugs that hasn't been fixed in nearly a year.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								12/10/14 UPDATE: There's a new patch! Nope, nothing in the way of actual content...they've rewritten three major aspects of the game (graphics, AI and new voxel engine). REALLY?! After over two years of development, they're still rewriting the basics. If this doesn't say "STAY AWAY" to you, then nothing will. ORIGINAL REVIEW: This might be an awesome building/fight game in about eighteen years or so. I love building games, and as a result I get easily bamboozled by the promise of games like Castle Story -- take charge over a group of vaguely humanoid bipedal lumps named 'bricktons' and have them build castles and buildings and such, make weapons for them so that they can defend themselves against all manner of goblinry. There's gonna be mayhem and fighting and explosions with arrows and stuff flying everywhere. With catapults and everything.Unfortunately, as it stands right now, it's little more than a tech demo -- the UI is flaky, making it difficult to mine and build anything. The Bricktons tend to stand around more often than actually do work due to incomplete AI. Despite excellent graphics and animation, the game itself has a unique lack of polish to it -- it's tough to even know what to do in a logistics sense, and the UI makes doing it a struggle even when you've figured it out.What's worse is that Castle Story has been in development for an amazing length of time for it to be in such a state (just over two years at this point, and their kickstarter has been funded to the tune of $702k when they asked for just under $30k). As best as I can figure out, the development team had to rewrite vast sections of their game for some reason or another at some point last year (rumor has it to accommodate a Linux version, which is preposterous if it's true).However, their development blog of late has been more concerned about their going to PAX East and moving to a new office than trivialities such as the state of their game (and reading between the lines, it would seem as though their time at PAX didn't go so well...which is hardly a surprise given the state of the game currently).All-in-all, avoid Castle Story for now. Hopefully it's coming out in the next two years or so and I can change my recommendation. I play a LOT of early access games, and this one is frankly the second worst when it comes to time in development.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								Well, simple put... i dont know where to start... So here goes nothing. First ill talk about what the game is. Then on to other things for new players. First This game... ITS SOOO GOOD. It's utterlly my dream game still in the works! You start off with nothing but your spawn crystal and some yellow plebs. the game has a spiritual feel because each pleb dude has a soul pretty much. and like the old japanese hermit said in that one movie or show... everyone will return to which they came... anyways. they are your builders... then you got the Warriors and Archers. which look sick btw. Then you got the curruptrons which are rocky oppisites of them yellow plebs i talked about. they will hunt you if you do survival or conquest. (game modes) Now that we got characters done lets move on to the game itself, You and your plebs go on to venture the floating islands with cartoony or voxel..aly really-really-great-graphics-for-this-voxel-game. As you venture youll notice there is a day and night cycle. You should probably get some shelter. So now... you put down some stockpile platforms and then you order half you men to get wood and the other half to start a quarry or use that nearby mine. From there.... It will leave you one question. Question? you ask... If it wasn't obvious it was WHAT to build... the options are LITERALLY UNLIMITED. thats why i like it. The game has wonderful phyics that make me tear to the tree that just fell off the floating island that i wanted all the way to making me tear for the shear beuty of shooting the supports on a cliffside castle with explosives and a cannapult. Now medival is kinda the theme of this all, but it isnt just castles you can make... Palaces, Cathedrals (Can't spell today sorry), Over hangs, MASSIVE Castles that expand to lots of nearby islands. Ragdoll physics are there and probably the MOST IMPORTANT TIP AND FACT... Its a waiting game.. kinda... you need to be able to wait. Its a long term game. meaning your projects will take some time mainly because you need to go for the resources and build probably a warehouse for the resources needed for the Huge castle design blueprint that you made. that warehouse might not be enough. This is why i wished the game was A TAD bit more faster. BUT its COMPLETELY fine to me how it is in my opinion. ands thats just that. Its a great game. Definitly A game to try and worth doing a youtube series on in the future (wink) anyways, I think i wrapped up most of the parts i wanted to talk about... SO THEN... I HAVE ONE QUESTION FOR YOU... What will you build with your Plebs? :P

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Rather cute game, which I wasted a few hours on.Now as a disclamer, I do realise that this is an early access game, but as it stands, it is barely playable. At this point the core game should be up and working, with a few minor bugs here and there. (i.e. No major game breaking bugs.)Firstly, I was constantly fighting with the pathfinding/AI of the bricktons (Workers).Half the time they would either get clogged, run on the spot, refuse to be assigned to an objective, become unselectable, sometimes wait 5-10+ secconds to figure out a simple path from A to B, take the longest and most inefficient route and in general; they do not do what I want when I want it. Almost NEVER.You have the choice between two combat units: Archer (Ranged) and Soldier (Melee)The Soldier being useless, as 99% of the time will run past the enemy he's chasing.So you have to basically rely on archers. Except they're prone to shooting each other in the back, and trying to shoot through your resource stashes, destroying them with a single arrow.There are also catapaults, Which i couldn't figure out how to work (Couldn't seem to assign any tasks to them or drop stuff on them)The level design looks cool, but functionally is an absolute pain to deal with.I lost countless resources (Trees and stone) into the abyss thanks to them (especially the trees) being next to the edge and 95% of the time, the physics would tip towards the edge instead of inwards. (And you have no control over how they fall.)There is also no variety in the enemy's you face. Only the one zerg rush type. The save system is also buggy, I saved my first game (After about 1-2 hours of play) and then immedietly reloaded it. (There was a builder looping a falling sound, who was stuck in a mine.) It wouldn't load, so I lost that save.If the other reviews are anything to go by (And the release date of Sept 2013) It doesn't seem like any of these problems will be fixed anytime soon. There have been patches recently, but there are still an absolutly massive number of issues.This is interesting concept, one that I liked the look of, but has been very poorly executed. A majority of it seems to be implemented with Unity's stock-standard features, And it suffers for it.I wouldn't buy it again.TL;DR: Cute but terribly broken game with the outlook of few to no useful updates in the future. Go elsewhere.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								I will not be playing this game ever until it reaches full version. I played for less than 30 min on survival and one of my workers  got stuck in the mine when I hit recall workers to get my workers to safety. So there goes 1 guy but I can power through its just 1 bug right? Then my archer immediately after manages to shoot HIMSELF and kill himself. I didn't even wait to see what happened next because I had just lost two of my bricktons or whatever they are called. I understand it is early access but they hardley ever bring out patches. And when they do it is something small like 1 bug was fixed. I understand it is hard to make a game but within 30 min I encountered two bugs that ruined the entire experience for me. Lets hope they fix these bugs. It is fun for about 15 minutes at a time for me and not in survival. It has to be in sandbox because I just love building so I get to fufill that childhood dream but only for a bit before something happens and I quit the game again. Don't buy this game unless you can deal with bugs that may or may not ruin the map you are playing on. Great concept. When it works I love it. But it needs more time.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Don't buy this vaporware. The game hasn't been seriously updated for a long time - its still the glitchy, broken, bare-bones mess it was when it was first released here, and the deluge of "refactoring" and "bug fix" patches the devs have spewed out since then has done very little to change that. The trailer and screenshots are misrepresentations of the actual game. It has been nothing but smoke and mirrors, empty promises of new content just around the corner, only for more patches consisting of obscure bug fixes and background code changes. Anyone who still defends these developers under the pretense of "early access" is in serious denial of the fact that for all of the money they've made off of this "game", their progress has been embarrassingly shallow.

								I am one of the purchasers of this game back when they first released back in 2013.  I think I even bought it less than a month of their release date.  I must say they have come a long way...  Granted they are still Early Access, I do hope they are able to achieve a v1.0 and it looks like they're getting close!I will make note that I did not play this game for a good year or two, waiting for better updates and finally checking back, I am glad I did.  I will be returning to playing this game for countless hours to come!I understand many reviewers may not be happy with this game then, and even now.  But they DO forwarn you that it is still in Early Access.  For some of us, we may even be playing at an Alpha level and still enjoyed ourselves.  I was willing to make the purchase for an early access game like this one because I saw potential, and I still do.Ultimately, I would recommend this game in two ways: One, for those who are willing to endure some bugs and be a part of the development to create something great! Two, to wait for Sauropod Studios to break out of Early Access when they have everything smooth and crisp for all gamers.  For you builders, designers, and thinkers out there.  this game can definitely be for you.Keep chipping away Sauropod Studios!

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Edited as of 30/09/2014Castle story is a funny little building game about bricktons. You control them, commanding them to cut trees or dig stone and gems. With gems you can make torches and create more bricktons. In creative mode you can create buildings to your hearts desire, in survival mode you have to make a castle to defend against the evil corruptrons.Pros:- Nice graphics and artstyle- Make your own buildingsCons:- Hard (or challenging) controls to control your bricktons- Buggy- Little content. After your 2nd castle you will have seen it for now.- Develepors have not updated in approx. half a year, and the updates that have happened were bugfixes or similar background updates. Conclusion:Castle story can provide some fun, but in the end of the day it's a game with hardly any content. It's also not recommended to support developers that hardly seem to do anything.

								Pros:1. It's a fun game for the first little while.2. I really like the look and feel of the game.3. Local LAN Coop.4. Steam Workshop.Cons:1. There isn't much content right now.2. The game lags to the point of unplayability after an hour.3. My play style would be a slow build up of resources, build an amazing Castle and wait until I have superior numbers before attacking. So I play on easy... (Which is fun for me) - However, I cannot seem to get that play-style working. After an hour, my Castle isn't anywhere nearly finished, I have 3 swordmen and 5 archers which all die really quickly and my base is slowly destroyed by hundreds of tiny corruptrons whilst the game lags to the point of being unable to defend myself.Summary:I look forward to playing in the future. This game is not worth £15 currently. (I hope my funds go to making this game better) - If you're considering a purchase, I would say yes - because if you don't, the Developers might stop working on it and I will have wasted my £15... :D

content:

Early Access Review
								As an original KS supporter, I have been extremely disappointed in the lack of progress.  We have not recieved a proper beta and its been nearly 4 times as long as originally promised.I don't feel this game is ready to even be sold to "early adopters" or whatever scheme you want to call it.  Certainly this could change at some point down the line but save your money for now and if you are interested in the game, simply keep an eye on it and wait.  It's really a basic prototype which is being generous IMHO.You will also find that the community manager has no people skills and is difficult to put up with.  If I was the community manager for a game that has failed to even meet one single promised goal, I would be kind and respectful to my critics.  Instead, he is quite honestly a rude jerk which is unfortunante.  In the end, I hope the game is successful as it is a great concept but hold off on your purchase.##Edit##My original review was posted FEB 24th, 2014.  It is now Jan 20th, 2015 and there has been "progress" as in they have released a few patches, but the game is technically in the same state it was in, they got a new community manager who is worse than the previous one, and there is no end in sight.  If you buy this game, I will sit outside your house and call you a big dumb chump.  Steam should not allow this sort of unfinished garbage even on its store.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have owned this game since the kickstarter came out.  The video you watch still has more features than the version we have.  The slow progress would be one thing but the fact that we are stonewalled by the developers makes it much worse.  The only answer you'll see from the community developer is "we cannot make any statements regarding the game.".  They will not give us anything to show us what progress has been made.  We went from weekly blogs to monthly vlogs.  The first two vlogs were monthly, now they're 30+ days.  They give us insight into how a game is made but provide no measurable progress for new material that will be in the game.  From bugfixes to new content we haven't seen much of anything. Maybe we'll see a change but after 3 years it's doubtfull.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								When I kickstarted this it seemed promising. The Devs were straight out of "game design school" and seemed to have talent.Played it a lot when I bought into it's kickstarter, enjoyed it although there wasn't much to do.2 years on....still the same stuff to do, no new content, no progress as far as I could tell.The store page has a line that says "Do you want to be involved into the evolution of our project?". Many people do, but seems they aren't taking constructive criticism very well. The company policy is not to give out information regarding updates and when they will come for fear of reprisals from the community should they have to backtrack their information. Due to this policy kickstarter backers/customers can't get answers to their questions no matter how polite they are. Questions regarding new features/what they are currently working on get the same response..."We can't give you an answer/you will get to know in due course."Yes, it's EA, yes I backed it, I'm not bothered about the money wasted....I'm not that bothered about the lack of progress. I just won't play it, I have 100+ other games to keep me entertained.What does bother me is a new bunch of devs trying to push out their first game have not learnt anything about the PR side of game development.  They choose to batten down the hatches of their impenetrable bunker and just slowly get on with things without the input of the backers who 'want to be involved in the evolution of their project'Let's not be too hard on them though, perhaps they are reading and taking note of the discussions and or suggestions.....just a shame they 'aint telling the fans about what they are doing/attempting, would like to do or won't attempt to do from all the mountain of forum content!Early Access on steam needs to learn from these types of "developments". :Make it so that to be EA'd the devs are contracted by way of "The Early Access Promise" to the community to push out lets say at least 3 major updates a year when in alpha, perhaps less so in beta. Every EA title must have a roadmap, a clear version 1 release date, or a set of goals per year that they must achieve within reasonable time frames.Lastly, every EA title that fails to deliver on these set goals/release dates should allow the backers to pull their money out and steam removes the game from their library and deposit the funds into their steam wallet.Doing the above steps would ensure that not only can customers back a project and have more faith in the team to deliver but also devs need to up their game to ensure they are organised and efficient in how they spend the money backers gave to them.After all you don't ask a bank for a loan for $1million to start up a business and they say "There you go, we will get the money back from you whenever". They want a business plan, projections of profit etc.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								Very neat concept but the game suffers from unplayable frame rate drops. On medium settings, game starts ok at ~ 30 fps, unfortunately it only gets worse as the game progresses. Searching threads for relief, I found dev posts all the way back to 2013 where they promised optimization, well, 3 years later, this thing chugs on my rig like I'm trying to play latest gen FPS with graphics set to ultra.Also, what's the deal with this game controller GUI? Can I have a simple "build" menu with all the items displayed in one overlay? The bad:* For a simple voxel game, graphical performance is horrible.* GUI - Keyboard / mouse unfriendly.* AI - Doesn't handle pathing issues / conflicts very well. The good:* If you can overlook the 3 above, the game can be pretty fun.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
Early Access Review
								This game is absolutely rubbish. They say that this is actually a working game, however, it couldn't be further from it. 12 Minutes was all I needed to see that these "minions" have had no thought put into how they move and what they do. They become confused, the processes to make them do simple tasks are too clunky and complicated. They are too hard to operate with. I bought this game thinking I could use it for its primary purpose; to be played with.  However, it is a waste of money. Simply looking around the map area is a laborious task in itself. There is nothing about this game that is simply easy to do or fun. There are so many bugs and things to fix I couldn't keep playing it. There are no tutorials or anything to tell me how and what to do.EDIT: I recently downloaded the game again after quite a while of having it sit in my "NOT WANTED" category. It's still awful. Despite plenty of time and the graphics on "fantastic", there are several graphical glitches, such as a lot of pixelation, missing textures and see-through blocks. It's like watching Youtube in 144p but worse. The controls are still too complex and overly sensitive. There's no tutorial that I could find and if you click the wrong thing, there's no way to un-do it. For the love of all that is good and holy don't buy this game. If you haven't, bend down on one knee and thank Gaben by name. Just go buy Minecraft*.*BUT NOT STORYMODE!

content:
Posted: April 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								Before you buy this, know that there has not been any significant content update for several months. I understand early access means in development, but that would actually require some development on the developers part.While the game is entertaining for the first few hours, it becomes boring quickly, lacking the ability to do more than just build a castle. The survival mode is moderately entertaining for awhile but in essence, its survive against waves that come at you in a straight line. Its predictable and therefor gets boring easily. There are several pros and cons, the pros being a unique new type of gameplay compared to other sandbox games, however it has many shortcomings such as lack of building materials and lack of blocks, which severely limits creativity. Making this sandbox game, not worth the money.Overall I cant recommend a game that is boring and has not progressed in development for months. If things change, I will definately change my review.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Terrible Developers.Over the last year they have been working on trying to make a simple voxelbased game work properly.There has not been a single new content patch and the game is still not working correctly.This is a basebuilding game where you defend yourself from Evil Rock-People that want to ravage your base at night.You do this by building and as time goes on you have to build strategical walls and place archers and soldiers inside your base.There is a multiplayermode that barely works where you can wreck havoc and do as you please to your opponent but as of now there is no co-op feature and setting up a server is hard work for those who just want to jump in and play as there are no dedicated servers.As it sound it is a faily simple game yet quite hard in the later levels if you play in the survival mode. Though I woud still not recommend this title as it is not going anywhere. On it's own it is quite fun but it is a thing that you would only spend a few couple of hours into and then never touch it again until they add more content and depth to the game.I've only come back to play it because the first hours was a pain since nothing worked.Might be worth buying on a 75% sale.

Early Access Review
								I strongly recommend this game if you like building games.In this game you begin with a few workers and start extracting ressources to build the castle of your dream, or anything that you dream of, hire more workers or soldiers. You place the blueprints and they will build it. There is a variety of ressources, stones and wood blocks and structures such as columns, door, catapult, lights and more.


Simple lighthouse

By: ¥ Noldaz ¥







Wood challenge construction

Castle Story

By: ¥ Noldaz ¥




There is also a fighting part to the game, if you play invasion or conquest mode, you have to defend against hordes of evil creatures called corruptrons.I have this game since a 2 or 3 years and development of the game was continuous, features are added regularly, and the devs are close to the community, they listen and reply to feedbacks and suggestions.The is a multiplayer mode, which is basic at the moment but will get optimised soon according to dev team.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7
Early Access Review
Castle Story is a quite interesting game to be honest. I've wanted this game since 3 years ago when I couldn't play it, do too it only could be played on Mac from what I've seen on their forum. But one day I saw it again, but this time It were on Windows too, but this time your game would be saved in steam instead, so I didn't have to do anything in their fourm, which I didn't understand. xDAfter Some time they've even added Multiplayer, which I have never asked for. So I brought two of my friends and played with them the first week it was added. And we had a great time killing each other, even if one of us couldn't join. but we kinda grew up, and I had a really long brake from this game, but then But thanks to them they brought my interests back with new updates and their stream on Twitch, that show us the work they've done, that might even be added.   But the gameplay, Is really fun once we get to know the "Map Editor," which is basically were you create your own Sandbox island or D-day as I would call it, since the Bricktron (your enemy) will swarm you and kill you one day. If you are playing playing Invasion, of course. But there is a Sandbox mode, but **** that! xDNow I am just waiting for the "Map Editor" to make so you can place your own stone bricks for your castle, because I don't want to build an amazing castle every time I die, I am right?But this game is a 8/10 if you're a guy like me that love to build and fight, with your very building you have created!

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								The ability to let the player be creative in the making of forts and castles is a very important feature in a game like this... and it is done well here.I bought Castle Story a while ago (before many of the current feature were implimented) and had fun creating catles and defending them. A couple months ago I rediscovered Castle Story and had a blast with the new features like Conquest Mode.While playing the game I didn't really encounter any bugs or glitches with the game.  Pros:-Allows Creativity-Interesting setting (on floating islands in a sort of isolated place)-Different features allow for more types of play style.-Challenging yet excitingCons (some might just be my computers fault):-while building castles I find it difficult to build or fix things on the inside of the structure-when I have been playing for a bit and the waves in Invasion Mode start to get more difficult I find that I need more        Bricktrons, but my gameplay gets a bit choppy when I get to around 7-8 Bricktrons. When I get to 10 or more Bricktrons my computer just can't handle it and will either crach or become very difficult to play.-when I put my archers up on the walls they will do fine unless I choose to fight with my swordsmen too. Then I have to micro-manage them to make sure they don't hit friendly troops.Overall: Castle Story is a good game and is worth the money. If I had to give it a rating it would be 8/10 (my rating will probably be higher when the game has been completed) still though if you have the creativity and a computer that can run the game well, then for you it could be way better than you might think.As a little note for the end of my review I would like to be the selfish player who puts out a few ideas that I have no right to demand for but would still like to see.    :)-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------1) It would interesting to see a way to play as the Corruptrons either in singleplayer or multiplayer. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------2) A way to save creations would save a lot of time as well as giving the players a way to hurry past the parts of the game  he/she may find tedious.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------3) In Sandbox mode it is super fun to just go nuts and build a bunch of stuff but it would be interesting to see how such creations would fair in Invasion Mode, but it can be boring to have to rebuild them block by block (especially if they are large creations). So a way to put Corruptrons in Sandbox Mode would be fun and allow players to test their creations before starting an Invasion Mode playthrough. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------4) It would be fun to be able to rename the Bricktrons to names that are more personal or funny.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Thats my thoughts on Castle Story. I look forward to seeing how the game developes.I hope this review has been helpful. Thank You for reading it.-Mr.DuckP.S.: I love the Castle Story website.

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5
Early Access Review
								TL;DR -> Castle Story is about building Lego castles and defending said lego castles with lego people against either the CPU's evil zombie lego people (in co-op with other players online now too), or against other players lego people in multiplayer. Its fun for folks who like lego in simple terms.Yo, you like lego? Yeah, me too.So I bought Castle Story way way waaaay back in its early days when it was first released on steam. Back then Castle story wasnt fit for purpose, and it had soooo many problems and bugs.Now, instead of taking to the steam forums and filling up the review section with whining about how "EARLY ACCESS IS BAD" like most steam-kiddie reviewers tend to do nowadays, I waited for the game to be closer to finished so I could see what I'd actually spent money on. A good 4 and three quarter years later the game still isnt 'quite' finished, but its rather close to it.At first, development on Castle story was quite slow, very slow in fact. Its the one thing people had the most issue with and rightly so too. As of last year however (2016) development has started to ramp up and the game has exponentially increased in both size and quality, adding multiplayer and completely revamping/adding new things that it so desperately needed. Castle Story as it is right now is definitely worth its price tag, more-so if you have people to play it with. The best part though is that it isnt even finished yet, and hopefully we'll be seeing even more new stuff added to the game in the future.

content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								I was one of the kickstarter backers of this game back in 2012. Back then I was really excited for Castle Story, but because of school and other reasons I forgot that I owned the game when it was finally released on steam. Over the years I kept an eye on the game, and was pretty disappointed that no significant improvements had been made on it until now. Only very recently did I find out that I had a key, and decided to give the game a try.All I can say is that Castle Story has made some pretty significant progress over the past few months. Blueprint coping, multiplayer conquest mode and the map editor were all very much needed features for the game.The only qualm I have is the lack of variety of maps, but with steam workshop integration in the works, community made maps will be much easier to download and play.Very excited for the future of this game!  8/10

content:

Early Access Review
								Every update is 1 step forward and 3 steps back.  Developers are fresh out of school, and have no skills at project management.   Some day, some year, this game may actually become playable, but I expect that day will be many years in the future.  That's assuming the developers don't completely run out of Kickstarter and Steam Greenlight funds first.  The only semi-positive note about this game is that the developers are still working on it.  But following this development process is like watching a blind kid trying to drive a car.Reasons for negative review:  AI is horrible. Path-finding is horrible. Now you might say "well, it's early acess, blah blah blah".  With each update the developers boast about how much they've improved the AI and fixed the pathfinder, every update proves this to be false.  The pathfinder and AI function should realy be at the base of the game, and if it's not correct, the game will never be worth playing.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
Early Access Review
								Castle Story is a variation on a tower defence game, you get resources & a team of men to build a castle to protect a power crystal from corrupted trons. Your bricktron men can be workers collecting resources & building, or archers & soldiers to protect against the corrupted trons. You can add a small variety of torches, doors & catapults to your castle to increase its defensive capacity. It's fun for a while, but building a castle can be a slow process. Bricktrons often get stuck or caught on items, or end up bunching up together as they all attempt to perform one task. Gameplay is very limited beyond thing & development on the title appears to have completely stalled. Not worth purchasing until closer to release.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								I love the graphics and the concept, but the user interface is too complicated.  Too many m enus and too many buttons to push.  A few suggestions that might make the game easier to play...maybe some of them are already into the game, but I couldnt get far enough to find them.  I only played for about 5 hours but couldnt seem to make much progress.1) Pressing space bar everytime you want to move the camera is a pain.  Scrolling could be accomplished more easily by moving the mouse cursor to the edges of the screen.  Camera rotation should be as simple as pressing the right mouse button and moving the mouse.2) Too many menu options make it difficult to wrap ones head around the game.  For example, there are two build options. Each build option has its own menus.  Why not put them all under the same menu, and order them from simple to more complex.  Its the same with mining.    There is mining for the ground, and then a mining menu for mining cliffs.  It would be easier to put them all under the same menu.3) Creating tasks can be really fun, but not for simple things like harvesting wood.  In order to harvest wood, you have to create a wood harvesting zone and then send workers to harvest the wood.  The zone is currently too small and harvests only a few trees.  What would be really neat would be to left click on a worker, hold down the left mouse button to bring up the worker menu, then mouse button up to select the "harvest wood" option.  The menu dissappears and the cursor changes to an axe.  Left mouse button down where you want the center of the zone and then mouse button up when the zone is large enough (basically create a custom size circle by dragging the mouse).  You can do something similar with mining, although you could have a couple of different shapes (circle, square, straight line, etc)4)  The AI is messed up.  I dont have any suggestions there because I cant see the code, however, the little buggers keep pausing while doing tasks, If I had to guess I would say that they are stuck in a code loop.These are just a few suggestions.  I wrote code to pay for my college degree, and have been designing software for over 25 years.  One thing i learned is that the interface is everything.   This is a REALLY COOL game but its just too difficult to play.

content:
Posted: May 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								I found myself interested in this game before it was even available on Steam. I became excited with the concept. On the outside it looks cute and intresting, the Developers promised a Castle building wonderland where you construct and defend you castles from strange night corrupt versions of your builders. This peaked my intrest because it was both simple, yet engaging, not over complicated like a lot of games have become. Just clean good fun. So when it was available for Early Access I of course bought it. Now it has a lot of work to do, most of the basic concepts are there but a lot still need to be included, and a hell of a lot of work needs to be done on the features that do exist to remove bugs and glitches and other nastys. I know what your thinking, it's Early Access, thats to be expected.Well... That was a year ago.Nothing has changed, nothing has been added, sometimes a small bug fix will be released but nothing more. I don't even check for updates anymore. They game developers have taken at least a million dollers for this and yet nothing. I'm afraid like a lot of early Access games they have taken your money and ran. This game, and a few others like it have ruined Early Access for me. I no longer intend to buy them because of it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								I really want to like this game. It's essentially a castle building/defence simulator that has potential in droves. However, the game faces problems in the AI and has not had any significant updates for ages. Castle Story's AI is servicable at best, but the 'bricktons' will constantly stop and admire the scenery. The AI is at it's worst when assigned to a building project. They will constantly build the closest block to them, meaning that quite regularly, they will completely freeze as their pathfinding spends time trying to redirect the brickton. This wastes precious time in survival mode when you are trying to set up defences before the next wave of enemies comes charging in.The lack of updates makes it feel like the devs have almost abandoned the game, as in the past year there has been no significant update to the gameplay at all. The promise of world generator has been hovering around ever since I bought the game a year ago, but I have still to see any evidence of it being implemented into the game.TL;DR : Game has large amount of potential but falls flat with buggy AI and lazy dev team

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								Status as of 2014-07-19.Cute game that has immense unrealized potential.Minecraft de-light in RTS setting.Features: - 2 game modes: Survival, Sandbox, (currently editor is disabled) - A few stone blocks & structures - A few wooden blocks and structures - Some awkward quasi-magical explosive devices. - 3 units, worker, Melee, Archer - 1 map (of questionable design)Bugs: - Very few, game has never crashed on me thus far.Annoyances: (This is where the experience currently falls flat due to being an RTS) - Clicking on unit does not always result in selection of said unit. - Drag-select does nothing when beginning on anything but empty ground. - Right-click to move, sometimes does nothing. - Melee units does not always attack nearby units - even when attacked. - LOS for Archers is not transparant. - Archers will gladly shoot through friendly units, damaging or even killing them. - Worker AI, while improving, is still frustrating. (Getting stuck, slow to respond, etc) - Interface is clean but feels extremely clunky for some operations.This game is very close to being worth a few bucks, but as it stands it gets boring within minutes. Beyond fixing the issues listed under "Annoyances" the game needs a few more maps along with _at least_ one more game-mode(why not a assault the stronghold, opposing strongholds, or similar) before I would recommend it to anyone. The game is extremely charming and I really wish the developers would give it some more features before it becomes another "Towns"-vaporware-product.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL;DR: Look at games like Stonehearth or, for the brave, Dwarf FortressIssues- Poor UI: The user has very little idea of how to access anything and the UI is SLOW and cumbersome (too many clicks). Shortcuts are a hit and miss, with none of them being mappable! Huge mistake for a game of this nature. The animations are also way too long for opening every little menu.- Performance: This has gotten a lot better, as it seems the bricktrons can figure out something to now. Although there are times where you see them stop and think.- Game Play: Super abundance of gold and iron while no blue crystals in sight! (Blue crystals = spawn more guys). The game is excessively challenging and losing more than a single bricktron at the beginning is crippling. Save frequently!- And the wood system... I still cannot understand the physics behind. GL making floors for your casltes!Pros:- The genre is relatively slim and this game brings a LEGO like approach to it.- The graphics are charming (except the UI).Overall:After years of coming back to and attempting to play this game, I will finally bring myself to uninstall it and won't look back on it. For a game I started following 2011, the five years has been rough on Castle Story.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
Early Access Review
Summary:Don't buy this game unless you have friends to play with, you like doing  the same thing over and over and you like an AI that is dumb as a it comes.What's wrong:Replayability:You have 3 gamemode: sandbox, invasion and conquest which is a multiplayer only gamemode.There is no substance to any of those, you just have to repeat the same tasks: build, defend, create yellow shitling and you repeat.The workshop maps are good, but by the time you played 3 of them, you just want to do something else and never come back.Gameplay:As stated before, you don't have much to do appart from building and fighting, which are both annoying and boring.The fighting is the most basic thing they could have implemented, you place your yellow shitlings where they can shoot or hit the grey guys and that's it.For the building, there is so much to say.The variety of blocks is wild: arches, stairs, squares, cubes, rounded useless♥♥♥♥♥♥and some siege thingies.Even other building/defending games like Besiege, Minecraft, or even Lego Creator Kights Kingdom that came out in 2000 and was already a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥back then.And all of those games had more content after a few months after release.The AI:It seems trivial nowadays to talk about a mediocre AI, but in this game we hit rock bottom.The AI can only go from point A to B, move ressources and exchange ressources to free to way.When building it never plans which part would be best to build first not to get stuck later, which, trust me, happens all the time.You will spend more time getting them to do their job than doing something usefull in the game.Performance:To put it simply, the game eats more ressources than it should, it's unoptimized and will make your computer overheat to a point than even other ressources intensive games never reach.Graphics and Audio:It's average, nothing to remember.Your will ear and see the same things all the time, keep youtube on the side with some music, it will ease the pain.Conclusion:Don't buy it unless you have money to waste or you like this kind of empty games.And don't say to yourself: "I'll buy it and get a refund later", because Steam doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥ if you played 3 hours and you feel violated and want to get a refund.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is the earliest early access game I've seen so far....basically a prealpha with patches that come rarely and when they do, they are literally padded nonsense that makes it look like they are patching but if you load the game and play it, you'll notice nothing...some game breaking bugs are still there 6 months later....no content adds..oh wait...we did get hats....and the devs have more than enough money to write a game that would be functional but are too busy finding ways to launder that money into their own pockets and not providing us a good game....9/8/2014 updateI'd like to see more minerals/crafting/units/gameplay/ ANYTHING. Still not sure where this game is going, I ask what the end result will be and was promised for 8 months that a road map that clearly told me what I wanted to know was coming. The roadmap analogy:A man stops you saying he will paint a picture of something you will enjoy. I'm intrigued, so I give him 15 bucks and he hands it to some french guy who splashes some paint on the canvas. It's pretty but so far it is just a splash of paint and clearly doesn't hold my interest long enough to call it art. I wait, but the french guy walks off with my 15 bucks to a coffee stand and orders some coffee and sits down. The original guy I handed my money too tells me that he is just taking a break for the christmas holiday;an hour or 2, and will be back shortly. I'm a bit unpleased, voice my opinion, and say I'll be back. I come back a couple hours later and the french guy is back at his canvas staring at it but nothing has changed. Instead, I see he has made himself a nice shiny billboard moved to a larger part of the park. Hmm, perhaps he needed more breathing room, I try to talk to the french guy, but I'm completely ignored, but the original guy comes back, we will call him, crate, so crate tells me that he is working hard but all I see is the same splash of paint on a canvas from before. Annoyed with crate and the french guy I walk away. A couple hours later I decide to check to see if my painting might have done anything. Holy hell, The painting still hasn't changed, I inquire to crate about WTF is going on. He tells me that the painting has changed and shows me a list of things he says has changed but it is still the same damn splash of paint and NOTHING has changed. The french guy is absent, Crate informs me that he went on a buisness trip down the block to promote his painting. Hmmm, should he have something to sell before advertising farther? The french guy comes back shortly after with another guy. They talk and the other guy leaves. I ask crate whats going on and he informs me that the splash of paint on the canvas is all wrong and needs to be corrected. The french guy throws a white sheet over it and says it'll be fixed shortly. An hour later I come back and the two guys are talking about their unveiling of a new improved "refactored" version of the painting. The white sheet gets pulled and....ITS THE SAME ♥♥♥♥ING SPLASH OF PAINT from before. I voice my opinion and low and behold, hundreds of people like me are now standing with me wanting answers. Crate answers some, but most are silenced with a quick hammer to their heads. An hour later, I decide to check on it, I'm not sure why at this point, perhaps it's the mentality to watch a train wreck occur, you know it's going to sad but also like, HOLY ♥♥♥♥, did you see that guys brains go flying all over. Anyways, you'll never guess whats happened, that's right, NOTHING....that splash of paint is still there, but now theres another painting right next to it with marks pointing to the other painting saying that this white part of the canvas is almost done while this smear hasn't even been started. I'm not even sure where to begin here, I still have yet to be told what this painting will be in the end, I was told I would enjoy it, but so far 93% of the people that bought this painting, HATE IT.....

content:
Posted: March 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Since the developers are being extremely frugal with updates for this game (read: they haven't released a SINGLE UPDATE for over half a year), yet claiming they're working on it (according to their Kickstarter newsletter, at least...), it's difficult to praise Castle Story. Sure, it's got a pretty original idea, with the only thing possible to compare it to being LEGO, and the visuals are nice, but an early access game that's never updated just can't be praised. AT ALL. I've played a lot of early access titles, and they've all (or at least most of 'em) been updated at least semi-frequently, with both bugs-n-glitches fixes as well as the chunky content updates. But Sauropod Studios just seem to completely focking ignore giving the community ANYTHING whatsoever to play with, or even TO PLAY! So my recommendation? Don't waste a single cent on this shïtty-äss scam of a "game"! 1.3/10

								A promising game, I enjoy playing it so far though there are some issues like pathfinding, memory leaks increasing ram ussage and minor bugs, overall I expect them to be worked out over the course of development aswell as their news on upcoming patches are very promising, the next one at the time of this review will speed up action time aswell as pathfinding for the AI which will be very nice. This game is fun and challenging but what else would you want from a castle survival game ^^ If anything keep on eye on the game to see when the development of the game reaches a point in which you are happy with it to buy, I am happy with my purchase and look forward to future patches to make it even better. I also do not know if the price will incrase after release but it is something to look into if you plan to wait. oh and a tip, two stone thick walls are useful aswell as putting bricks behind your archers to stop them being tossed off the walls when the corupt throw their rocks at them.

content:

Early Access Review
								 I've got alot to say about this game, both good and bad but mostly good, I'll start with the bad. I know the developers are working on the game and that they've had alot of trouble with the pathfinding in 3D for the bricktrons (but now it's working perfectly!). But content in the game is not so noticeable, new enemies and wooden ramps and a couple of curved bricks and all that but in the mean time my archers are shooting all my knights all the time, that makes me ending up with a hundred archers and just a handfull of knights placed at locations not reachable by the archers. So my general tought is prioritations, but on the other hand, it would't be wrong to have a ballista, boiling oil on the walls, workshops with a smith to upgrade your knights etc etc etc... the name IS castle story and the medieval guys had some pretty sick and awesome inventions that's just waiting to be reincarnated digitally, I really recomend the dev's looking in some history books. And a few other things that bugs me is that i cant place catapults or stockpiles on wooden floors, I mean, that's how everything in this world is built.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Side note thing: I think this game has a really good idea. I think the game itself is amazing too. I have no idea why people hate this. Every problem they said they had has never happened to me. I do think $20 for this game might be a little too much though. I think it would do better if it was atleast maybe $10-$15? I wont stop supporting these devs (No matter how much hate they get) UNLESS, this game utterly fails. Then id have no reason to support this game if it utterly fails.Anyway.Castle Story is a Resource Management,Survivalish game. You build castles and protect your castle along with a crystal that can summon warriors, archers, and workers. There are 2 different modes right now (Sandbox, and Survival) There is also a tutorial you can take too. Which I would reccomend. Pros: +Great idea         +Characters move just fine for me         +Nice musicCons: -A bit buggy with building (It is Early Access)         -Devs are a bit slow (but I dont mind)                                                                                     Thats all I have to say for now, This is all my opinion.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								I enjoy the challenge in this game, deciding "Do I need warriors, Archers, or workers?" the ultimate struggle. The only thing bad things I have to say are the absurd amount of resources it takes to spawn in new guys compared to how long it takes to get blue crystals. And I'm assured that it could be just me, but I can only play this game for about 20 minutes at a time. I get relatively bored of it fast. But I do think the gameplay and challenge are interesting, but I also enjoy the sandbox factor. Being able to customize and build a fortress as I see fit while fending off hordes of rock monsters.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								honestly it is quite fun, it has multyplayer (although i have a glitch were my game freezes and they have to save it then load it again, and this happens alot, a dev told me it was because i had it for a long time and they are trying to fix it, and this is only in the multyplayer mode) which is alot of fun to play with your friends against each other or against the AI , it has a sandbox mode so if you want to build your dream castle you can do that there, a survival mode which is a mode were you survive againt waves of corruptrons increasing in difficulty, a conquest mode which in multyplayer non co op is you against your opponent or multyplayer co op or single player is you (or you with your friends) against the corruptrons were you have to try and capture every crystal on the map, which the corruptrons are doing as well, and a map editor if you want to make your own maps and post them on the workshop and you can also get maps from the workshop and download them, honestly there is alot to do in this so it will be a while before you get bored of this gamemy only problems with it is the bugs and AI (which it is not finished yet so it is bound to be fixed)and some things i would like to see done in the game which would be a vs AI mode were its just like multyplayer non co op were you try and defeat the enemy, which in that case it would be AI, also i would like a blip sound when someone chats because it is a little annoying always looking at chat to see if someone chatted or not, and a way to disable stockpiles so bricktrons will not try to dump recources into them as i have had a few issues with the ai going to a dead base and then getting shot at by archersoverall i think if you dont mind bugs you should buy this game as there is alot of content to it especially for a early access game

content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is going no where fast. There hasn't been a single content patch since this released on steam (sep 23 2013). It's just been minor bug fixes and that's about it. I am not sure how many people work for Sauropod but it seems it's a one man team. It will take them 2-3 months to replease a patch to fix bugs including no content at all! I backed this game in 2012 and I've regreted ever since. They released the beta(?) almost a year after their expected released date which was just ♥♥♥♥ing insane.I go and check the updates done on the game every month or two and I am dispointed every, single, time.The release to steam was a joke, it was pretty much the same game as the prototype with the tacted on broken survial and mulitplayer options. Well besides I think they rebuilt the whole engine because of their god damn incompetence. AND GUESS WHAT? THE ENGINE IS STILL ♥♥♥♥ING BUGGY. The Bricktons still go brain dead when they get stuck, just a ton of minor bugs that seem so obivous but haven't got fixed in "patches" that seem to only fix minor bugs.It's stupid how LITTLE these devs have done in two years.As you can see from the current ratio of thumbs up to down(6:94) This game is not worth 20 ♥♥♥♥ing dollars, hell it's not worth 10 dollars.Stay away!___________________________________________________________________________________Update(6/8/14)They are done rewriting their♥♥♥♥♥♥code for the second time and it only took them what a year? Oh yeah everything is the same. Maybe a few less bugs. But still zero new content. Still not worth getting. Get a better Indie game like Space engineers, they update EVERY WEEK. With quallity content. Castle story hasn't had a single content update since it hit steam. Sure some small fixes here and there but zero content. --Update(3/28/15)Still no signs of any devlopment

content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game USED to be a great lot of fun, even though its updates was SEVERELY slow it was a fun surreival game, i didnt much enjoy the sandbox mode as it is just overall pointless tough. It USED to be fun in surrival mode, however the last few updates they've pushed out has COMPLETELY ruined that. The edition of a new enemy creature a big hulking golem that just ONE SHOTS everything! Your meele units which was a NEED to keep hordes of minions away has now been demed COMPLETELY useless. And it takes 1-2 rounds to spawn one of your own minions! And you need archers fighters and builders. So yeah fighters are USELESS now to the incompetent Balancing. Not to mention the stupid ♥♥♥♥ing ai targeting. You'll be reloading your game atleast 2-3 times every late round after wave 8 because your archer kill one of your other archers! They just KEEP ♥♥♥♥ing killing eachother..So as of now, the game is NOT worth 20 euro. Not even 15, not even 10. Anything below that and its a worth while game to grab if you got nothing else to go for. 4/10 personal score. It used to be great, but the recent updates with crappy AI and unbalanced scaling has just made it a worthless experience.
