number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								Every update is 1 step forward and 3 steps back.  Developers are fresh out of school, and have no skills at project management.   Some day, some year, this game may actually become playable, but I expect that day will be many years in the future.  That's assuming the developers don't completely run out of Kickstarter and Steam Greenlight funds first.  The only semi-positive note about this game is that the developers are still working on it.  But following this development process is like watching a blind kid trying to drive a car.Reasons for negative review:  AI is horrible. Path-finding is horrible. Now you might say "well, it's early acess, blah blah blah".  With each update the developers boast about how much they've improved the AI and fixed the pathfinder, every update proves this to be false.  The pathfinder and AI function should realy be at the base of the game, and if it's not correct, the game will never be worth playing.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've abandoned this game for 3 years until recently, and i decided to try it out again, see what's changed. Not THAT much has changed, but there are noticeable differences. I abandoned this due to the AI at the time, but now the AI is actually competent and the game is playable now. The game might be slow paced as they have to mine rocks in order to build bricks, but it is quite fun building. There is quite a variety of blocks to choose from, from normal 2x1 to rounded ones and archways. Stairs too. 3 years ago the edit mode (mode to place blocks) was extremely difficult to use and it just wasnt fun to build. But now they've refined it and it is quick and easy to select and place blocks. No snapping in the wrong places anymore. There also are other modes where you get attacked by rock monsters and you have to defend yourself by placing down archers and catapults, which is fun. I mostly like sandbox though. There also is multiplayer, but i havent tried it yet. But from what i've heard, multiplayer is stable. So the end verdict? This game might not be perfect, but it sure is shaping up.7.8-10

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								I wanted to like this game. It was like building in minecraft only you have a small army of AI units to tell what to build. On paper it sounded great but I have massive doubts about the developers ability to refine this game to a playable degree. The .3 patch reverted about a years worth of bug fixes and has nearly broke the game to an "unplayable" state. This game is plagued with bugs that will waste hours of your time trying to figure out how to work around it just for the sake of stacking blocks. Their video blogs are just annoying to watch as all they do is talk about what they would like to accomplish while never really hitting these goals. It sounds all great but little to none of it ever gets ironed out. I bought this game over a year ago and have seen little forward advance. The last big patch cranked down the texture quality in order to increase the map size but failed to fix the major problems that these smaller development teams seem to struggle the most with. Mainly the AI's pathing issues. They constantly hang up and get "confused". In the end I could spend the same amount of time on minecraft survival solo and build more then 20 bricktons could accomplish even after hours of fine tuning how to work around the many bugs castle story has. The grand goal of this game seems to be able to mass an army of AI builders to construct an elaborate fort to defend against the corrupted but in the end if you could seize control of just one of the bricktons and manually control them you would do much much better to achieving this goal. At that point I have to say just stick with minecraft. Until you see a tidal wave of reviews saying they have finally made the AS (artificial stupidity) actually resemble AI, then steer clear of this struggling under developed game. Good idea but an extreme failure to polish into a playable game.

number of helpful: 16 of 32 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								You know I really like world builder type games and I love RTS and this game promised to be both. Did it succeed? No but it also didnt fail. Castle story had alot of potential but these devs have abandoned it. And if the devs are reading this dont start typing up a respose saying "we haven't abandoned the game." because yes you have. I have had this game almost sence day 1 and I'm still having the same bugs and issues and the biggest one is simply the main focus of the game. The more blocks I place building my defenses the more it lags. It starts to get really noticable around the 80 block and 10 bricktron point. and the lag gets to the point where none of the bricktrons were taking commands and I was experiencing .5 fps... Thats 1 frame every 2 seconds. That is beyond unexceptable for a game thats been out this long. I may not be running a $1,000 gamming pc, but if my machine can handle "World of Tanks" and "World of Warships" running the graphics on normal settings why can I not play this game on the lowest graphic settings without lag so intense that none of the units respond? Yes there have been content additions. Yes there are some really nice tectures. But if the game basically becomes unplayable after 30 minutes of game play whats the point? Maybe if the devs put out a patch or update that fixes whatever is causing such intense lag I'll consider changing this review but until then 2/10. not total garbage but not worth a quarter of what they're asking for this game.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
Early Access Review
								TL:DRDev saw I was not happy, then he helped me step by step and now I'm enjoying the game a lot more.It means a lot to me when the Devs interact with the players and take the time to help out.I couldnt for the life of me figure out how to create a stockpile, needed to refine and store resources for building, so I pretty much couldnt do anything and the Tutorial was not helpful with this task. Basically all the power in this game comes from holding down the RIGHT mouse button and depending on what or where you are holding the cursor, the options will change. SOMEHOW i missed this but all is well now.I tried playing this game a few times over the years and struggled with the tutorial and wasnt able to figure out basic game mechanics. Tried it again today hoping to see that it had changed because I was always keen to see where this game would go, but alas. I was stuck in the same rut as previously. I went and wrote a review explaining the faults I saw and decided I'd be back in a few more months to see what has changed.Well, one of the Devs went saw the review, added me and offered to help, he politely explained step by step what I had missed and now finally I am able to play!The tools (once you've figured them out) are simple and the options limitless as to what you can build.Really stoked to have been helped by the Devs and its made all the difference with my attitude towards the game, go sell some of your unused AWP skins and pick this game up, these fat little yellow men are way cuter than your 'worm god stat track' AWP anyway.

								So I played the game ages ago. And then remembered that it was on steam. I then saw that the Devs actually remembered that they had made this game and that it was super broken so they did a update for the first time in 2 years. content:
Posted: March 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								1) This game is not for everyone. The core gameplay focuses on creating castles, one block at a time. Most gamers would find this game tedious and boring (as did I).2) There are only three gameplay modes:-Sandbox: The only thing you can do is build a castles-Survival: I found there was very little challenge in this mode. I got bored after 2 hours. I'm not sure if the developers realized that it's more efficient to build walls at choke points on the map and station archers on the walls than building a single castle that leaves your workers vulnerable to attack while working (especially while the recall button doesn't work properly).-Multiplayer: couldn't get it to workI wouldn't say that $20 is a fair price considering the lack of content.3) I wouldn't say this game is bad. It's just that it isn't for most people and has a very narrow appeal.

Team, big thumb up there) !In Castle Story, which has nothing to do with CS, you will have to defend your Bricktrons and their/your Cristal, against the Evil and Bad Corruptrons, or even other player playing Bricktrons. The enemies come in waves and you just try to hold out.Conquest: there is some crystalls scattered around and you have to take them all.It's a early access game and it feels like it. You get a pretty bare bones game with some fun gameplay! If you want to build some castles, this game is for you!

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Do you like obtuse radial menus? Then Castle Story might be for you! But wait, there's also buggy little yellow dudes that get stuck on everything including but not limited to terrain, each other, trees, and much much more (there isn't anything else in the game). Combat is an exciting mix of either instantly killing everything that attacks with a single archer, or losing everything to a single overpowered enemy that one hits everything you throw at it!There's also many exciting game modes, varying from nothing attacking you with lots of tedious clicking trying to get units unstuck to a trimmed down mode where you can't change the terrain and the previously mentioned enemies attack in progressively stupider waves. Although, I guess with the way the yellow dudes get stuck on everything the lack of mining is really more of a blessing.Did I mention how your yellow dudes get stuck on everything and then just stand there waiting for you to move them yourself?Horrible control scheme mixed with utterly stupid pathfinding and task queuing system makes this game a NO! Maybe worth $0.1999. Save yourself the trouble of requesting a refund and skip the story these developers failed to tell.

content:

								I should've listened to the top reviews and saved my money for some other game. I found out about this game in the early days of development, then forgot about it. Now, today, I found it again and though I'd give it a try - despite the negative reviews. After roughly 2 hours playing, I understand them. At first it worked fine. But the longer I played, the less my Bricktons responded to my commands. At the end, just before I quit, my minions refused to dig a dunnel, despite the pleasant words I gave them and the smooth jazz I played for them. Also, the stockpiles I built before I quit were invisible, and I couldn't manually put stuff in them.I'm sorry, devs, but I cannot recommend this game.

content:

								The concept of the game is what will undoubtedly convince you to purchase this game if you have not already... I think the concept is awesome... That being said...  If you dont care about things like... game breaking bugs, or being able to actually build things in a game about building... then this is the game for you... Sure once you figure out what the bugs are and how to work around them you can start to get things done... and thats what a fun game is all about right? Bugs are fun to figure out how to work around... it makes you feel special and smart... also keep in mind that this game is early access so things are still being developed... they are right? its not like the game has stayed almost exactly the same since its been released or anything... I really really wish i could get my money back. For the love of god... i will never back a game or buy early access untill i do more research on the devs themselves... just having a good concept for a game isnt enough. The concept of this game is the only reason its still bearly alive and not vaporware.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of bugs; however, none are particularly game-breaking and can be easily overlooked.Sure, it crashes when you shut it off some times, but you lose unsaved data anyway, so it's not like that's a big deal.Castle Story is a very interesting game: the simple mechanics belie the complex strategy the game is capable of. It's an excellent exersize in resource management, and the end-result once you get good at it is simply breathtaking.The strategic learning curve is fairly steep: be prepared to lose a few times figuring out what works and what doesn't. If the mechanics weren't so staggeringly simple, I would compare it to Dwarf Fortress.The price tag is a little steep, but if it goes on sale, even 25%, I would say it's definitely worth a try.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								A few years ago, they were deleting topics that disagreed with them from the forums, and development looked dead. I recently took a look to see if it had gotten anywhere, and it's really taken off. There's weekly developer livestreams, great interaction with players, and new content, bug fixes and optimizations rolling in regularly.I love the freedom you have to mess around with the world, to create or change chokepoints as it fits your strategy. On the side of things to improve, to me, it feels a bit too fast paced as I like to think things through well and make sure everything's 100% right. And the game doesn't really like the scale I try to make things in.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I first came across Castle Story a few years ago, I spontaneously bought, and got a few of my friends to get it aswell. However, after realizing that the multiplayer at the time was "somewhat" unplayable, my friends lost interest in it. I gave the single player a chance, and ended up spending the majority of the next few weeks accumulating a few days worth of gameplay. By that point however, I felt I exhausted the amount of gameplay for the very early access version game. Needless to say, it was still a great time spent in both the survival and sandbox modes, using the unique building system and hybrid resource collection system, while commanding an army of yellow marshmellow men. Jump forward a few years, I tested the game again recently, and was very impressed with the complete overhaul of the game. I had been following the game's developement for a time, but actually trying it out, I was very glad with the changes the devs brought, and their active role in the community. I definetly got my money's worth out of the game, and I encourage others to see what this game offers.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I found this game a couple of years ago. It looked like a fine game, with nice happy graphics, and a different gameplay. I believe i am right about the gameplay being "different"...... you start out with a couple of workers. An update made it possible to go into mines, so you would not dig holes all over your world, to get minerals. But when you have created your very base of your castle, things just goes wrong...... When you command your workers to build the castle a little higher, they just stand there in about a minute and do nothing. Then the night comes, and the monsters comes, and the workers ... well ... they die because they still tried to figure out how to build the castle a little higher. That is probably the biggest issue about this game, even when you cut down trees, the pieces of wood like explodes all over the place because of the gravity. The workers can´t figure out to do something for themselves or something as simple as go through a door, or to drop block of stone, so you have to control all individualy, and how easy is that when you have about 20 workers??Now to the good stuff ...The very idea of the game is great.The graffics are very good.there is different modes to play in, and different worlds.The game is hard, and only gets harder, in a good way.An update that brought a new enemy to the game, that was challenging in a great way.so .. not everything about the game is bad ;)Though, this is only my view of the game.But when i take a look at the price for the game, i say no. Don´t play it. unless you want to use hours to see your workers die over and over again, because they are trying to figure out to do something as simple as going through a door, or drop some stone... xD

content:
Posted: May 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Think of Castle Story like you are a God of minecraft players and you really want them to build castles. At its core gameplay this game is fun, I haven't done much of survival yet, as I was mostly interested in creative mode. The game has some quirks and some stuff needs improved, such as pathfinding speed. Once you have multiple bricktons working on the same project they get confused at times or have a hard time getting where they need to. Especially if you have two trying to use steps on different jobs, they both sit there going, "I can't reach my destination." I feel like this game needs to add more to what it has, otherwise its going to be very short and repititive for people. It has multiplayer but no way to search for players. No good way to get rid of ores you don't want.Pros:Fun building gameNice looking simplistic Graphic DesignInspires CreativityCons: Still has a way to go with polish and game playGlitchy2-3 modes with few levels to play onNo Global Multiplayer

content:
Posted: May 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Its fun for about the first 15 minutes or so, then you get a bug where your workers  will simply stop responding to tasks. Imagine, if you will, playing Age of Empires when al lof a sudden, one of your villages won't do anything. Then another wont, eventually you can't build anything in your task group anymore. Really stuffs you up. Looking at the forum, this seems to be a bug that continues to plague users. Its a shame, I know when I saw it on Kickstarters for the first time it looked hella fun. It really could be a super fun game too, but the bug is game breaking. It could use more than two maps, perhaps one with large terrain as everything seems like small bits and pieces connected by land bridges.I'd say wait for some time, keep an eye on its updates if you really are keen for it. When it appears the bug effecting your workes productivity is gone, then give it ago. Or wait until its like, two dollars or something.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								A few years ago, they were deleting topics that disagreed with them from the forums, and development looked dead. I recently took a look to see if it had gotten anywhere, and it's really taken off. There's weekly developer livestreams, great interaction with players, and new content, bug fixes and optimizations rolling in regularly.I love the freedom you have to mess around with the world, to create or change chokepoints as it fits your strategy. On the side of things to improve, to me, it feels a bit too fast paced as I like to think things through well and make sure everything's 100% right. And the game doesn't really like the scale I try to make things in.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								When I first came across Castle Story a few years ago, I spontaneously bought, and got a few of my friends to get it aswell. However, after realizing that the multiplayer at the time was "somewhat" unplayable, my friends lost interest in it. I gave the single player a chance, and ended up spending the majority of the next few weeks accumulating a few days worth of gameplay. By that point however, I felt I exhausted the amount of gameplay for the very early access version game. Needless to say, it was still a great time spent in both the survival and sandbox modes, using the unique building system and hybrid resource collection system, while commanding an army of yellow marshmellow men. Jump forward a few years, I tested the game again recently, and was very impressed with the complete overhaul of the game. I had been following the game's developement for a time, but actually trying it out, I was very glad with the changes the devs brought, and their active role in the community. I definetly got my money's worth out of the game, and I encourage others to see what this game offers.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								So, I have 26 hours in Castle Story.I have been with this since very early in its conception, way back into the days of around .3 or so.Heres what I have to say:This game is one of those that can really give you a fun and challanging gameplay experiance. It may not be for all people, but few games really are. Castle Story is one of those few games where you can make legendary stories of your play, stories of heroic units fighting of massive odds, or building that legendary structure and the trials and tribulations involved. Its mechanics are solid, and continuing to improve. The difficulty involved in the survivial mode and the conquest mode are enjoyable, and present a challenge as you move further on and increase the level of difficulty. This game may be early access, but it is by far better than many. The development team actually LISTENS to the community, and has made great leaps and bounds in its production of the game since the early days. They started of with two developers making this in there own home, and now have a full team devoted to giving us a game that will meet the expectations we have put forward.Now, this would not be a fair review if I did not put at least some of the problems forward. The ai has improved massively since its inception, with greater and more efficent pathfinding and work orders. But archers will still shoot themselves in the foot. Or they will put an arrow in the back of your valient warrior holding back the dark tide of enemies. Or a fellow archer who happens to be between them and thier target. Now, this is a component of the difficulty of the game, as stated by the developers, and I can understand that. Its kinda fun for me to come up with ways of preventing such friendly fire incidnets, but it can become tedious to micro your archers to prevent fraticide among the lot. Especially once you get further on in the survival mode with dozens of enemies breaking down your door. The only other real major complaint I have is it is insanely difficult to actuall bridge islands, something that could be seen in the earliest of promotional material for the game. with the improvements to the building system, it is sightly easier, but not very much so. These problems are more annoying than anything else, and for me dont detract very much from the game. And as I said previously, the developers are paying attention to the community. Plus, they are keeping us up to date on developement, and thier should be a pretty big update coming along soon that will really make the game shine: World Editor. For so long we have been teased by that greyed out button in the menu, and just over the horizion is that very World Editor we have so desperately wanted.My Rating for this game: 9/10 would buy again :)

content:
Posted: January 20
Early Access Review
								Castle Story is the first game I ever kickstarted and why I did it was because of the concept. To build your own castle with resources a la Minecraft and defend it in the way you like. But nearly four years have passed since they got to the Early Access model on Steam - I'm really disappointed what this game I really wanted to become. When I got the prototype access version, it was buggy and reasonable to me. Tried the game again (now in Early Access) about two years ago and it was really buggy couldn't do anything (!) - workers just stood there and did nothing, no tutorial how things works in the game, controls was clunky... so I tried to play again with a friend and realized that she had the same problem. In frustration I uninstalled the game.And two years later after my rage quit, I took time to see how the games is going. After 30-40 minutes of gameplay, I must regrettably say that I can't recommend this. I'm really sad because I want to love this game, but in current state? No. - And I think it can't be better. :(... But Sauropod Studios, please prove me wrong...

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								A game that once had potential. But over the 4 years its been in early access, it hasnt shown any improvement. The ai is very disappointing because you tell your bricktrons to mine a quarry but they just stand there confused. The ai's pathfinding is a pain because a bricktron will build itself in an unexcapeable situation, so you'll have to either build a little staircase or delete some blocks to get him out. The devs are just plain lazy. They say they're working on the ai, but it just got worse over the 4 years its been in early access.The maps can be frustrating when you chop down a tree and all the wood just flies off the edge of the map. Your bricktrons will always be getting stuck in mines and on ledges, so you just have to let them die when the next wave of enemies comes around until you lose all of your bricktrons forcing you to restart the game.The ui is also very terrible as I struggle to navigate the horrible selction wheels and try to find the right tool in the menu.1/10 HAD potential.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Castle Story is a physics based sandbox defence game that challenges your Ingenuity in creative and strategic ways.The game leaves you to decide how to best fend off foes wether you build, terraform or prepare traps and defences with penalties if you take shortcuts to structural integrity ^^My experience have been mostly possitive in light of being an alpha/beta. Although if you are buying before release heres what bumps to expect.- They have alot of ground to cover when it comes to ai because of how they often run into trouble and you are forced to maticulously backtrack and test your way to find the problem. - Building has been heavily slowed due to the ai and you will more often then not build intricute scaffolding to finish your constructions only to tear it down and collect later.- Never ever have the same blueprint for wood and stone (has yet to be fixed).- Your archer minions are heinous backstabbers that kill off the others. Guide their hand well.The game provides unique gameplay from person to person, beutiful ambiance, physics that makes every encounter new in many ways, overall an intersting game i cant wait to play as a finished product.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								It is surprisingly fun to build a castle, brick by brick. Sandbox is really relaxing, and will let you flex your artistic muscles. Conquest and Invasion on the other hand, are not. And with the latest update bringing PvP over Steam, the frenzy of battle has reached new heights. Highly recommended for fans of strategy games, and builders of all ages.Plus, the developers are really helpful, and will frequently stream on Twitch, playing against community members, and showcasing new changes. After the hurdle of rewriting the entire AI, the game has been updated frequently, and with new features almost every month.

content:
Posted: January 13
Early Access Review
								I have always enjoyed the concept of being able to build your own base and defend it in the way that you like; this is what originally drew me to castle story. When I started playing around 2 years ago, I had so much hope. At that point, I never found a game quite like Castle Story. While I am glad that I did find the game as it has yielded some interesting gameplay, I would have to regrettably not recommend this game. While castle story does do a good job of offering the chance to build yor own base in the way that you see fit, it seems that it is encumbered with basic issues that make the overall experience much less enjoyable. An example of this was today, when I decided to come back and test the game, which, having happened after an update to the game, made me update  my save files, rendering them to sandbox mode from their original invasion mode. This update has dramatically changed the core gameplay of the game and I believe that it is worse for it. It has taken the little joy that I have felt towards the game out. I will come back again in a few months and hopefully be able to update this review positiviely, but only time can tell.

content:
Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								Let's start off by why I do NOT recommend buying this game.Personally I loved the idea of having a "GOD" game where you could micromanage the whole building construction and plan out buildings in advance. But this is becoming like the DayZ of GOD games. Each time you launch it to see if they have fixed anything since you last played, you just end up finding more bugs.f.x.AI: The minions, after a while they become unresponsive and don't follow any commands. Your new game can work fine for a bit and then when there have been too many actions performed they stop reacting and moving altogether.Even with the devs best efforts, the updates have been minimal and at best bandages for the game. (Last update 0.8 - 22.12.2016)There are still huge flaws in the game and some of those should have been fixed even before the early access release.This game is a fun idea and nice spin on both pvp and basebuilding games, for the first hours I really did enjoy the game and how it was styled but a huge let down is the development speed.Considering the early access release date for the game: September 23, 2013, the game has progressed at snail pace and I suspect that it will never leave early access and if it does, It will be in 2035.Wait for the "full release" if it ever comes out.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
Early Access Review
									This here’s a lengthy and informational review on the game Castle Story.	Please note that this game is still in development, and can and, in fact, probably will change (seeing as this game is far from finished and there’s lots of work to be done).	What is Castle Story? Its the story of, well, a castle. You get these cute little guys called bricktrons who want to defend themselves from ever increasing waves of little ankle-biters known as corruptrons. How exactly? A castle (duh). There are 3 types of bricktrons currently in game. The first is the worker bricktron. This cute plump little guy is the backbone of your fortress. He will gather resources such as wood from trees and rocks or orange and blue crystals from mines (or pits if your playing in sandbox mode). They can also place bricks (automagically converted from rock in stockpiles) to form your castle. There are also various structures you can build such as doors, pillars of wood, planks, lanterns (trust me, you’re gonna need them), etc., as well as stone structures such as stairs, pillars of stone, half-bricks and arches. The next kind of bricktron is the knight bricktron. He is armed with a sword, shield and helmet who defends the castle. They have a HUGE amount of health compared to the other bricktrons, and work well with the last kind of bricktron, the archer bricktron. This bricktron is armed with a bow, quiver full of arrows and a sexy Robin Hood hat. These bricktrons are able to shoot corruptrons at range (albeit not as accurately as you’d think). However, their health is rather weak, so their main use is on top of battlements.	Then you have the antagonists of the game, the corruptrons. There are only 2 types currently implemented. The first and most common type is called the, well, corruption (it doesn’t really have a name). They are short, stocky, weak little guys who go for your bricktrons and structures. They can also throw rocks at archer bricktrons to stun them for half a second. They are one-shot-killed be arrows, and two-shot-killed by a knights sword. The other type is called the big corruptron. This guy has HUGE health and can one-shot-kill knight bricktrons. However, he is really slow.	Wood is used in wooden structures, stone makes bricks, yellow crystals make lanterns, and blue crystals make more bricktrons. Simple resources.	That there’s the game. Now to my analysis.	The game idea itself is FASCINATING. Its stronghold meets minecraft in a way. But it takes a LOT more time than you’d think to build your castle, and it really is VERY difficult to build a castle and defend it like the one in the advertisement. Heck, your corruptions wont even come through the front door, they’d rather just pummel through your walls, right under your archers where they cant shoot the attackers to defend the wall. In fact, it is nigh impossible to get a castle even closely similar to it. You might see only one in your entire game experience. That is, however, NOT the most outstanding issue, that being the AI. The AI is completely broken, ironically through a huge patch that featured ‘improvements’ to the AI. How you ask? Here’s some reasons.	Corruptrons, once they’ve found a target (which is right when they first come into being far, far away) will NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER pick a new one until he’s updated through being blocked from his target or the target being destroyed. Even worse, knights can’t attack moving targets because they have to stand still for a second to rev up their attack, and by the time he’s ready, the target has moved out of range. So its impossible to hurt enemies with a knight unless they pass right by you or are attacking their target (which could be the knight). Even WORSE, this mechanic makes big corruptrons completely overpowered. Since they one-shot-kill any bricktrons, knights are not an option unless the big guy is attacking a building. Archers are supposed to be the counter, but fail for 2 reasons. Archers have a TERRIBLE accuracy, and so are useless until you have LOTS of them (which is FAR beyond when the big corruptrons come out). Secondly, Big corruptions have LOTS AND LOTS of health. It ill take you at least roughly 10 arrows before you could DREAM of killing one of these things. Fortunately, since these guys are slow, they come after the much more spry corruptrons already die, so all your archers should be able to pick out the big guys. But thats REALLY hard in the early game when you may only FRANTICALLY save up blue crystals in order to get maybe one or two archers. The only viable option is to hope he targets a bricktron, then use it to kite the big guy around while your archers hurriedly fill him with arrows.	Your worker bricktrons are dumb as rocks (BA BING BAA, JUST GO PICK UP THE WOOD LOGS! I KNOW YOUR SAD ABOUT THE TREE YOU CHOPPED DOWN GOING OVER THE CLIFF BUT COME ON!), and they run away from corruptrons…sometimes straight into the claw of another corruptron.	Thats not all. The UI is TERRIBLE, and organizing stockpiles is pretty important (especially to make sure not to stockpile blue crystals so that they put them straight into the great crystal (It’s so uncomfortable to type crystal)), but annoying. Once your castle really gets going, builders take at least 3 seconds to decide where to put the brick they just picked up. The graphics are not great. The developers are too busy fixing the mess to actually add a lot of content. Nobody’s on the multiplayer. Planning a castle before it’s actually built takes a long time. Because of the targeting system, its really hard to defend your workers before you have a castle (before the 4th wave or so). Sometimes, workers decide to play fair and let a corruptron hit them. Archers give friendly fire, and are VERY naive about it. etc.	Now on to the suggestions to the developers. I’m thinking that either the big corruption should be slower, have less health (or boost archer attack), or deal less damage (COME ON, ONE-SHOT-KILL?!?). I think that instead of making different types of bricktrons, your bricktrons should be able to ‘arm up’ either with craftable weapons or automagically. This would allow you to have more kinds of resources to find, and allow you to have different tiers of weapons. The game should definitely have more of something to it than castle building I think. I myself am a game designer, and so feel qualified to make a couple suggestions/propose some ideas.	So what do I think? Don’t get this game until the developers hopefully fix it.4/10With fixing, it has the potential for at least 8/10Bye for now - HydralskMan!

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								So I decided to update my review. I have owned this game for quite some time now, and I like the game, don't get me wrong, but there are things that the Devs need to work on.The main issue is lag, now before I updated this review, I stated the lag has gotten better, I now retract that comment, and say, its much worse, worse then it has ever been, and thats over the last couple of updates that I have noticed this, My system hardware has not changed since I got this game, My system is not slow by any means and there is NO reason this game should cause lag like it does, not one other game lags on my machine at all, with all the graphics maxed out, this one lags like hell with the graphics turned all the day to fastest, the lag when I first got the game was very minimal, some points that make it difficult, but never to the point that the game lags now.When you first start, little to no lag, over time, you add more workers and warriors/archers and then it just gets bad, unplayable, and all I had was 12 workers, 6 archers and 1 warrior, i use to easily triple that when i first got the game, with little to no lag, but to make matters worse, add in the waves of enemies and then you can't even control your guys because the lag is so bad, a good gamer can micro their units and take no damage, but when you get so much lag that you cant control your units, the game is over, unless you got good defences and playment of your archers and warriors, but if you play like I do, you rely on micro management and move your characters around to take as little damage as possible, lately I try a game and the same thing always happens, i lose within the first 2 hours because of lag.needless to say, like I stated months ago when I first wrote this review, this game does not show progress, it is showing regression, do not spend money on this game, the developers aren't showing any promise anymore.I know it takes alot to make a game, I know developers have a lot on their plates, but this game lost its hipe a long time ago, when the developers decided to address content over improving the game for better performance, or maybe they lack the ability and experience to do so, either way, I can not say that this game is worth supporting anymore, unless the developers can get their♥♥♥♥♥♥together and fix the lag in this game, it is a dead horse.I am no longer following it at this point. On a side note, when I first wrote this review, there was like a 65% positive review rating on this game, and now its dropped just above 40% positive, so I am not the only person who feels this game needs extreme work.

Early Access Review
								I had some really high hopes for this game and I still want it to succeed. With that said, I supported the kickstarter and still only have less than half an hour on this game on Steam (I played back with the alpha test as well). The concept is really awesome. The biggest issue I have is how badly implemented the controls are. It feels really counter-intuitive. I don't know why they're trying to reinvent the wheel, but it really doesn't work. I hope they learn from the negative reviews and put some more thought into the game. This is definitely one of the reasons I'm not supporting Kickstarters and Early Access anymore. I know development is a lengthy process, but you really have to consider why there are such scathing reviews and why other Early Access games can actually be fun to play.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2015
Early Access Review
 Typical Kickstarter game development cycle Guess I can't blame them, they got everyone to give them money for a just-playable game alpha, why bother going beyond that? Development is incredibly slow, and the improvements that are made while nice are not critical issues. New textures, shader and enemy types do not help AI that struggles with basic pathfinding and multitasking. I love the concept of this game and think that visually it is just the right amount of visual splash and cute/basic asthetic, but I cannot recommend anyone who didn't purchase it during the kickstarter support the dev team any further. I would normally add to this that in the future I hope to change my review to a YES like I do with any game that has sufficient patching and support post-launch, but I don't think this is going to be one of those sadly.UPDATE: Years later still in early access, which either means they a) have no concept of the time required to develop a game or b) knowingly sold a game years ahead of release for full price.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
Early Access Review
									This here’s a lengthy and informational review on the game Castle Story.	Please note that this game is still in development, and can and, in fact, probably will change (seeing as this game is far from finished and there’s lots of work to be done).	What is Castle Story? Its the story of, well, a castle. You get these cute little guys called bricktrons who want to defend themselves from ever increasing waves of little ankle-biters known as corruptrons. How exactly? A castle (duh). There are 3 types of bricktrons currently in game. The first is the worker bricktron. This cute plump little guy is the backbone of your fortress. He will gather resources such as wood from trees and rocks or orange and blue crystals from mines (or pits if your playing in sandbox mode). They can also place bricks (automagically converted from rock in stockpiles) to form your castle. There are also various structures you can build such as doors, pillars of wood, planks, lanterns (trust me, you’re gonna need them), etc., as well as stone structures such as stairs, pillars of stone, half-bricks and arches. The next kind of bricktron is the knight bricktron. He is armed with a sword, shield and helmet who defends the castle. They have a HUGE amount of health compared to the other bricktrons, and work well with the last kind of bricktron, the archer bricktron. This bricktron is armed with a bow, quiver full of arrows and a sexy Robin Hood hat. These bricktrons are able to shoot corruptrons at range (albeit not as accurately as you’d think). However, their health is rather weak, so their main use is on top of battlements.	Then you have the antagonists of the game, the corruptrons. There are only 2 types currently implemented. The first and most common type is called the, well, corruption (it doesn’t really have a name). They are short, stocky, weak little guys who go for your bricktrons and structures. They can also throw rocks at archer bricktrons to stun them for half a second. They are one-shot-killed be arrows, and two-shot-killed by a knights sword. The other type is called the big corruptron. This guy has HUGE health and can one-shot-kill knight bricktrons. However, he is really slow.	Wood is used in wooden structures, stone makes bricks, yellow crystals make lanterns, and blue crystals make more bricktrons. Simple resources.	That there’s the game. Now to my analysis.	The game idea itself is FASCINATING. Its stronghold meets minecraft in a way. But it takes a LOT more time than you’d think to build your castle, and it really is VERY difficult to build a castle and defend it like the one in the advertisement. Heck, your corruptions wont even come through the front door, they’d rather just pummel through your walls, right under your archers where they cant shoot the attackers to defend the wall. In fact, it is nigh impossible to get a castle even closely similar to it. You might see only one in your entire game experience. That is, however, NOT the most outstanding issue, that being the AI. The AI is completely broken, ironically through a huge patch that featured ‘improvements’ to the AI. How you ask? Here’s some reasons.	Corruptrons, once they’ve found a target (which is right when they first come into being far, far away) will NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER pick a new one until he’s updated through being blocked from his target or the target being destroyed. Even worse, knights can’t attack moving targets because they have to stand still for a second to rev up their attack, and by the time he’s ready, the target has moved out of range. So its impossible to hurt enemies with a knight unless they pass right by you or are attacking their target (which could be the knight). Even WORSE, this mechanic makes big corruptrons completely overpowered. Since they one-shot-kill any bricktrons, knights are not an option unless the big guy is attacking a building. Archers are supposed to be the counter, but fail for 2 reasons. Archers have a TERRIBLE accuracy, and so are useless until you have LOTS of them (which is FAR beyond when the big corruptrons come out). Secondly, Big corruptions have LOTS AND LOTS of health. It ill take you at least roughly 10 arrows before you could DREAM of killing one of these things. Fortunately, since these guys are slow, they come after the much more spry corruptrons already die, so all your archers should be able to pick out the big guys. But thats REALLY hard in the early game when you may only FRANTICALLY save up blue crystals in order to get maybe one or two archers. The only viable option is to hope he targets a bricktron, then use it to kite the big guy around while your archers hurriedly fill him with arrows.	Your worker bricktrons are dumb as rocks (BA BING BAA, JUST GO PICK UP THE WOOD LOGS! I KNOW YOUR SAD ABOUT THE TREE YOU CHOPPED DOWN GOING OVER THE CLIFF BUT COME ON!), and they run away from corruptrons…sometimes straight into the claw of another corruptron.	Thats not all. The UI is TERRIBLE, and organizing stockpiles is pretty important (especially to make sure not to stockpile blue crystals so that they put them straight into the great crystal (It’s so uncomfortable to type crystal)), but annoying. Once your castle really gets going, builders take at least 3 seconds to decide where to put the brick they just picked up. The graphics are not great. The developers are too busy fixing the mess to actually add a lot of content. Nobody’s on the multiplayer. Planning a castle before it’s actually built takes a long time. Because of the targeting system, its really hard to defend your workers before you have a castle (before the 4th wave or so). Sometimes, workers decide to play fair and let a corruptron hit them. Archers give friendly fire, and are VERY naive about it. etc.	Now on to the suggestions to the developers. I’m thinking that either the big corruption should be slower, have less health (or boost archer attack), or deal less damage (COME ON, ONE-SHOT-KILL?!?). I think that instead of making different types of bricktrons, your bricktrons should be able to ‘arm up’ either with craftable weapons or automagically. This would allow you to have more kinds of resources to find, and allow you to have different tiers of weapons. The game should definitely have more of something to it than castle building I think. I myself am a game designer, and so feel qualified to make a couple suggestions/propose some ideas.	So what do I think? Don’t get this game until the developers hopefully fix it.4/10With fixing, it has the potential for at least 8/10Bye for now - HydralskMan!

content:
Posted: August 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have been watching this game for years, and I was fearful it was another pre-alpha money grab, then when a huge update came last month I decided to finally buy it. Are there bugs? Yes. However the only bug I have experienced was very minor and fixed by closing and re-opening the game, with no harm done. Castle story is a game that isn't easy to learn, for the first few hours I experienced things that I thought to be bugs, when in reality they were just mechanics that were not explained and I had no figured out yet. +3 great game modes+Great for creative minds+Castle Building+explosive catapult shots paired with nice destruction physics+great textures and models++devs active in the community+++World editor, still needs some love but recently added and all-in-all AMAZING (complete with workshop to share)+- Multiplayer that can be glitchy+-Patience required, not gonna learn the game in 30 minutes-tutorial needs some work-some minor glitches (then again this is still early access so disregard this one if you wish)-pathfinding will sometimes need micromanaging when too many workers are doing the same thing and get stuck -aside from multiplayer enemies don't have buildings to destroy with catapults :(Would I recommend Castle Story? Yes, though again, patience is needed to learn the ropes. This game is an amazing mix of building, RTS, (medieval?) and strategy that I highly recommend to buy.

Early Access Review
								I backed this from the beginning. Must be 2 years ago. Loved it, couldn't stop playing, even with the bugs. It was a game in itself finding a way round them until the game just failed. Lots of dev chatter and promises felt good.Then nothing really changed.I checked in every few months until the whole thing felt very sour.I've just booted it back up just out of boredom and curiosity. And it feels almost exactly the same. Just a slight graphics update, better UI and the bricktrons move a tiny bit slicker.. 10 mins of playing and one of them permanently bugged out chopping an invisible tree.Sorry, but after ALL THIS TIME if the core mechanics are still bugged and it feels like the SAME early development game I officially give up.So many great indie games have come and gone in this time.Word to the wise, read these reviews. Many of the posts with both rants and empty promises seem to be gone. Although they seem to have been replaced with new ones. Unsurprising.Not sure if it really IS a con, or the devs just simply suck. Who cares. Just keep your money and move on.EDIT: I just realised the youtube trailer that got me interested in the game (which is completely misleading and better than any build I've played) is 3 YEARS OLD.

I am glad the devs finally re-focused.

Posted: April 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Don't buy this game.I might change my mind in the future, but as it stands right now, this developer is probably the most incompetent and lazy I have ever seen.  I don't say that lightly.  They claim that they've spent more than a year refactoring and rebuilding the game engine, meaning there have been a total of zero content updates for upwards of three years.  Nothing has changed because of that.  Performance is still crap.  The game still crashes.  Save games still get ♥♥♥♥ed up.  There's still only like three maps, and the map editor has actually been turned off because it's so unstable.The glitches, bad performance and downright dysfunctional AI is what lies beneath the otherwise cute and attractive concept and presentation.  Notch was right when he said he wishes he had made this game, because it's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ disappointment and he'd have done a better job of it.You thought Starbound was a scam and that developer was a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ liar?You haven't seen Castle Story.  This is one of those games that people point to when they say early access sucks.

content:
Posted: October 1, 2016
Early Access Review
This is a reviewNo sh**IntroI'm not going to write about how long the development of this game has taken. It's irrelevant to the game in it's current state and to be honest, I doubt any other studio the same size as Sauropod could have done it any quicker. Some studios (Hello games) could have taken another year of two with their project.Another point before I start xD This is an objective review. I don't owe Sauropod a positive review. I'm writing a positive review because I belive the game deserves it.Pros and cons...Pros Satisfying building elements Beautiful landscape, especially with the undergrowth they showed in a demo recently An easy to use world editor in which you seem to loose hours of your life if you aren't careful A good game to play whilst listening to podcasts Friendly staff (as far as I know) You can build bloody bridges! Yeah man!! Bridges!! Things explode... Need to remember not to build barrels next to my walls for future reference Regular livestreams MultiplayerCons 8Gb of ram is not enough for conquest. You can manage invasion provided the corruptrons aren't digging too much Some of the controls aren't explained clearly enough. I for example didn't know how to use the camera properly xD Some mechanics allow you to become undefeatable in invasion mode, like digging away the island or spamming a                       line of archers, although that depends on the map you are playing. Trees don't regrow When setting a cleaning task that is above a quarry your cleaner will often decide to pick up rocks that your miners are currently mining and more often than not cause a jam. Corruptrons need a way to cross empty spaces other than beeftrons throwing minitrons. Perhaps they could build fragile bridge constructions with their own bodies. The bridges would decay in a couple of minutes and every piece of the bridge would sacrifice a corruptron EndAll in all I recommend this game. Just keep in mind that it's an early access game, there is always a risk involved with early access games.I have gotten enough good gameplay hours out of it to make it a worthwhile purchase for myself. Games as all other media is a very individual thing. I for example enjoyed the star wars prequals (insert unpopular opinion) matter of fact I think Revenge of the sith is the best movie in the franchise. So just keep that in mind. Even though I like this game, you might not.-Rain

content:
Posted: October 1, 2016
Early Access Review
This is a reviewNo sh**IntroI'm not going to write about how long the development of this game has taken. It's irrelevant to the game in it's current state and to be honest, I doubt any other studio the same size as Sauropod could have done it any quicker. Some studios (Hello games) could have taken another year of two with their project.Another point before I start xD This is an objective review. I don't owe Sauropod a positive review. I'm writing a positive review because I belive the game deserves it.Pros and cons...Pros Satisfying building elements Beautiful landscape, especially with the undergrowth they showed in a demo recently An easy to use world editor in which you seem to loose hours of your life if you aren't careful A good game to play whilst listening to podcasts Friendly staff (as far as I know) You can build bloody bridges! Yeah man!! Bridges!! Things explode... Need to remember not to build barrels next to my walls for future reference Regular livestreams MultiplayerCons 8Gb of ram is not enough for conquest. You can manage invasion provided the corruptrons aren't digging too much Some of the controls aren't explained clearly enough. I for example didn't know how to use the camera properly xD Some mechanics allow you to become undefeatable in invasion mode, like digging away the island or spamming a                       line of archers, although that depends on the map you are playing. Trees don't regrow When setting a cleaning task that is above a quarry your cleaner will often decide to pick up rocks that your miners are currently mining and more often than not cause a jam. Corruptrons need a way to cross empty spaces other than beeftrons throwing minitrons. Perhaps they could build fragile bridge constructions with their own bodies. The bridges would decay in a couple of minutes and every piece of the bridge would sacrifice a corruptron EndAll in all I recommend this game. Just keep in mind that it's an early access game, there is always a risk involved with early access games.I have gotten enough good gameplay hours out of it to make it a worthwhile purchase for myself. Games as all other media is a very individual thing. I for example enjoyed the star wars prequals (insert unpopular opinion) matter of fact I think Revenge of the sith is the best movie in the franchise. So just keep that in mind. Even though I like this game, you might not.-Rain

Early Access Review
								Edit: Do not buy this game. The devs have pretty much abondoned it in it's extremely unfinished state and it is not worth any money now that there is no hope it will ever be a good or even functional game. This is a very cute and fun idea and is still developing, however like other games like gnomoria that are also early access right now the mechanics are very limited still and the in game tips are pretty much useless, you'll spend the first hour clicking everything getting flustered trying to figure out how to do basic things. If you want to support the devs then buy it now, if you want a good game you can play for hours then wait till it's more developed which may take quite a while as it seems very slow to develope at the moment.The graphics style and the build your own castle stuff is pretty fun, the combat system is pretty bad right now your warriors kinda derp around and let all your workers die despite the knights being strong enough to kill enemies in one or two slashes. AIs overall need more work.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								Tldr: Bad encounter with 1 hostile dev, also had a response from a respectful dev. Review started as not recommended turned to recommended as the main bulk of devs care for the community more than it appeared.When I first played this game patch 0.5 (something) it was really laggy with the path finding and all. Could barely run the game after 40 minutes due to more units trying to pathfind. Now in 0.6 that issue personally for me is fixed, I have had no lag whatsoever since (haven't played for hours on end to see if it applies to very long term invasions). ProsPhysics (somewhat... bricktons may fall in the wrong direction when stone hits them :< )Smart AI (Tunnels their way to you etc)ConsSome bugs (comon its early access, you were warned)As its in early access things are very prone to changes.Island will not regenerateVisuals 7/10Multiplayer may need some things done to differentiate which unit is whos. (turns out to be rather big problem)Hats etc coming in the futurePlaybility 7/10As of 0.6 the major change was performance enhancements and no longer be able to choose what you mine, and stone being removed. During your playthrough what needs to be kept in mind is islands are not regenerativeCreativity 7/10CatapultsBuilding whateverUnique character namesDevs 4/10Staff employed during the 0.6 patch on the steam community team sat 50/50 with me, 1 person responded in a hostile and indifferent tone for no apparent reason and didn't answer my question, then another responded to my query politely and respectfully. When I thanked the 2nd person (basically case closed) the 1st guy responded again with a hostile and indifferent tone for no reason which basically tipped my 50/50 opinion on whether or not to recommend the game. Afterall the devs basically determines how the game would go.Overall opinion on getting the game 4/10After some consideration and indepth playing of 0.6 I personally didn't like the game anymore. But would still recommend the game. However that changed when I had a distasteful encounter with a staff member of the game's steam forum.Edit: The staff member in which I had the encounter with no longer is working with the devs. Whether through his actions elsewhere or inspections of his responses. Meaning the dev team cares more for the community than it had appeared to me. Therefore I reckon it would be a game worthwhile to get in early access as your suggestions would be considered and shape the final form of the game.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
Early Access Review
								Imagine a castle building game where you build dense walls to survive hordes of enemies, and use soldiers and catapults to repel their swelling mass at your doorstep. That is not this game. At least not the way that you might imagine it. I am aware that the game is still in beta when making this review and I can forgive things like work queue locking up, or the path finding of the workers taking them around the map instead of through the door I built for them. However, that does not excuse the terrible selection process, which is pivotal and my primary gripe. I purchase the game over 6 months ago, played it, got frustrated with it, but I did not condemn it. I reserved my opinion with the it's beta status in mind. So I came back recently, hoping that game had advanced and ironed out the problems. They did advance it and supply two game modes instead of one, and some prefabbed worlds, however my biggest issue still remained.Selecting your units is hit or miss, at best. Don't trust the drag select box. and don't trust shift/ctrl selecting either. You have select individuals and give them commands as individuals... assuming you can select them. The cursor will hover right above the intended target and somehow the hit box is not responding. So if you're ever in a pinch and you need to move your workers, might as well kiss them goodbye. You click frantically to simply select them and they die in the process after one hit. It was very frustrating seeing how my next issue is with the recruiting of new units. Maybe I'm missing something, but I've two dozen little stars floating around my crystal... why are they ALL used to make ONE unit? When later on there are only a few stars and it seems to be enough for that one unit. Hell, sometimes I've got plenty of stars and I can't make a unit. It was inconsistent and made no sense. The game otherwise is fine. Not really edge of you seat type stuff, but it fills whatever child-hood need there is to build massive structures with nothing but blocks, and then see it crash down when you knock it down. Not much in the sound department, and the graphics are very bright and friendly. I wish the enemies had more to offer, however since it's really easy to bottle neck them and shower them with arrows. With the problems, and low replay value, I can't recommend this game.

Early Access Review
								Castle Story has so much potential. The mechanics and overall concept of the game are fun, and the slow build up of a castle is always enjoyable. But this game has made me more frustrated than anything else. I have tried to play it and have faith that I will find leisure in defending my base, but every time I lose there is the overwhelming fact that I could have won if the game wasn't so slow to react. Please developers, don't give up on this game, because it feels as though you already have.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								I kickstarted this game back in 2012. It looked amazing. I got the prototype delivered in late 2012, and was pleased with the way things were going. I even recommended the game based on the fact that it was coming along nicely, if not still full of bugs (but then it was in alpha so i couldn't really comment.) It seemed to slow down from there really, bugs became the bane of this fledgling development studio and it looked like nothing was going to really change.It's now 2015. The game is still in early access. The game is still buggy as hell. I've installed and uninstalled it about 3 times since they released it on steam back in 2013, and every time I'm disappointed with how far the game has progressed. The AI is awful. The more "bricktrons" you acquire the more laggy the game becomes. Countless rebuilds and UI rebuilds. Fantastic idea, completely ruined by inexperienced games developers who seem to have no hope of ever producing their vision. All in all a very, VERY sad castle story.

								They're allowed to still call this game "Early Access"? It was first put up a YEAR ago, and there's been absolutely no progress on it.Which is sad, considering that the game's not bad in concept. But nothing works in the game. Nothing. People have reported various small bugs over the past year and they sometimes get looked at, but when have the devs ever tackled a larger issue?Who cares about a new material to work with when your workers get themselves stuck all of the time? Early Access Review
								Granted I only played this game for 40 minutes after buying it a couple of years ago, but that was because the AI was awful and the gameplay was so slow that it didn't feel like I achieved really anything in the time that I played. I reinstalled it recently to see what had changed and it seems that in that time the only real change is a new thod of building and new graphics, that would be great if the game actually was fun to play but unfortunately it seems the developers have decided to focus on adding new art, shaders and animations, when what it really needed was some gameplay speed increase and better AI, and most importantly, some sort of reason to play, at no point after leaving the game did I have any desire to return because there didn't seem to be any point.Overall, the developers need to get faster at working on the game, and make sure that the changes they make are big ones because your game could be the best looking game in the world, but it doesn't make it fun, which it isn't in its current state.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
Early Access Review
								[Current Review/ Opinion]I consider myself to be a really open-minded person. I want so much to love this game, but I really hate the devs. I've had this game for like a year, and nothing has changed. They pulled the "We're in early access so lets take 8 months off and claim we're overhauling our earlier systems" card. Now I hear they're adding modding - no doubt so the community can finish their game for them.This as a whole makes me... Sad. I just watched a video on the newest update (0.4.0). What changed? Idk, supposedly bricktrons are more intelligent. I see very little proof in this.If anyone is silly enough to pay $20 for this game at this point, ugh. I'm willing to meet you someday and give you the biggest hug and kick in your man/ lady parts. They want an arm and a leg for this unfinished garbage. It's such a cute game, and the aesthetic is so charming. But thats ALL it has to it. Don't, for the love of God buy this game or support the incompetence of the developers.[Old review for reference on how much my opinion has changed since 2013]I DO recommend this game, but heed my warnings before you buy it. It's Early Access. This tends to scare a lot of people off. This will be long winded (if I take the time) but insightful. Both pros and cons will be listed. This recommendation will be altered for better (or worse) as the game gets developed. Let's get started!Pros1.) Sandbox. Need I say more?2.) The games art style is unique, and in my opinion extremely beautiful in it's own respect. It definitely makes an impact.3.) The lighting is very well done. The glows of torches, and subtle dynamic lighting adds a nice touch4.) RTS-like managment (i guess). Multiple control groups/ tasks/ things to control at once.5. It's basically a sandbox tower-defense survival game. You collect resources and try to beat the time as you build things in which to survive. Day or night, the timer doesn't care. When it's done counting down, prepare your defences.Cons1.) The game runs slow when you get into the mid/ late game. You can tell optimization is lacking (Early Access)2.) The pathfinding needs some major reworking. Your workers are basically stupid.3.) Workers are basically stupid/ dysfunctional. This deserves multiple mentions.4.) The game isn't updated quite as much as I wish it were with groundbreaking fixes.5.) Archers, STAHP killing your friends. Seriously, why? Stop with friendly fire. OR. JUST. DON'T. SHOOT.6.) The game becomes quite repetitive in it's current state. You start off every game doing the same thing in the same location. You build up a little at a time, fight a wave, build a bit more, etc. Late game it just becomes a snore. Either you do, or don't have what it takes to survive that late. There's plenty of variety in the blocks, just simple character quirks make the functionality kinda... Clunky.7.) The f-ing control scheme. Don't even get me started. It takes some SERIOUS getting used to.

Early Access Review
								Be prepared to rage a lot. Your bases will get destroyed and your bricktrons will idle, even with work available, and your knights will be useless when compared to archer spam. Even with all that, Castle Story is still fun, its nice to watch as your castle goes from a tiny single tower holding all your archers to a massive fortress that holds siege engines and thousands of archers. I've never touched the multiplayer though, never found anyone willing to join me.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								I bought this game years ago and if it was an official release I would probably be demanding my money back; however, unlike all those negative reviewers here, I was fully aware that I was buying a half finished barley playable product because it looked interesting.has this game lived up to its promise and delievered to its full potential? no, absolutley not. but its an early release so I already knew this going in.building a solid structure from the ground up and fortifying it is a very satisfying experience, its like a strategy version of minecraft, but this game so far lacks a lot of depth and that is what I am patiently waiting to see happen. there was no promise of a release date when it was made an early release, the devs have not broken any promises and kudos to them for allowing us the priveledge of an open window into the progress of what I truly believe will be an excellent product when finished.to summarize, do not buy this game if you want to actually play it, that $20 they are asking for is a ticket to observe progress, not an actual game.I do beleive that $20 is worth the price of the show and if I knew then what I know now, I would have still bought it.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2016
Early Access Review
								Another update, and the on-going disaster continues. The new version is yet another step backwards. Invasion is just awful now. You must actually mine the stone itself, which sounds like a good idea until you consider the following:1. Mining speed2. Wave speed3. Unit speed 4. Atrocious pathfinding5. Rate of acquiring new units6. unit strength7. your patience to deal with years of sub-par developmentIn previous iterations usually very soon after a unit died you'd be able to replace them, you need to. Otherwise invasion isn't remotely fair. The waves get bigger and bigger and if your forces get smaller and smaller it's inevitable that you're going to die. With the new setup, you're lucky to last even a few waves on normal. No idea if they've fixed the performance associated with waves 9+ since it's difficult to last that long. You are given 4 workers to start. You send 2 to mine, and 2 to build and chop down a few trees to get started. By the first wave, you can barely have any stone at all, let alone units. By wave 2, you might have the start of a small section of wall. You usually have not gotten additional units by this point. By Wave 7 I had something resembling a box, but I'd only managed to get an additional 4 units by that point. Wave 7 consisted of something like 10 of those rock throwing enemies + big ones that one shot your melee units. Archers are useless against the rock throwers as any wall, etc that they are one, they're immediately knocked off of and the melee guys are one shotted by the big enemies. You're already outnumbered and your forces are pretty useless. The devs don't even remotely understand the concept of balance. They'll cry a sob story about it being early release, but after this long, I can't say that I ever expect this to turn into a finished product, let alone a good finished product. The UI is becoming unwieldy and awful. Constant changes, none for the better, make it confusing and time consuming to set anything up.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								2/02/2014TL;DR: Incomplete, bugs, steep learning curve, castle building fun but needs polish!An interesting castle building simulation game, where you hand build your castles block by block from the ground up.First Impressions: Survival Mode (Sandox wasn't playable at the time)1. God Damn IT!!!! Why aren't you minions WORKING!!!! Seriously at this point the AI is a killer. Some things it does well, others you have to manually solve for yourself, thus the second impression...2. Steep Learning Curve, you need to trouble shoot why your minions won't/can't build your castle. Hard to do if you haven't learnt the intricate steps your workers do to build things.3. Friendly Fire, basically your hard earn archers decide to kill each other!!!But after figuring out how to trouble shoot the AI problems, it is a fun game. Expect atleast 1 hr of frustration figuring out the controls.This is a game in early developement, and what they have is "fun" but very much incomplete and needs more work, polish and consistent updates to consider buying.Happy Building :)

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								Throughout the ages I've been more prone to pay Real Time Strategy (RTS) games.  However with the birth of "Sandbox" games I find myself seeking that desired game to have the RTS style with a sandbox methodology.  This game definitly has the possibility of becoming one of those games that I can truly enjoy.  Although I do find myself getting board with the mundain of waiting for the mining of enough resources to get more units I do find this game enjoyable.  There is definilte room for improvement, so if you feel like playing a very interesting game with a RTS sandboxy feel go for it, however from my position I would say hold on and wait a bit until they get more updates for this game, as the game play can get "boring" at times.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have been following this game for a while.  I just recently switched to PC gaming and this game is why.  I don't know much about game developing but I do know that Independantly Controlled AI is a real pain to program so dismiss any bad reviews about this game concerning the time it's taking.  I remember making a 2D version of this game on GameMaker and holy crap did that take forever.  Unless you watch this game grow up I would say wait till it's official release.  But if you're like me and a 3D RTS with Complex Controlable AI is a game of your dreams then I would highly recomend this.

content:

Early Access Review
								This game does not get NEAR enough credit than it deserves, while there are pretty much never any multiplayer games open, its very fun to face off with a friend in battle, the graphics, while cartoon, are very good, the main problems are the clunky AI (JUST PICK UP THE LOG YOU STUPID MINION!), the building physics (JUST PLACE DOWN THE STUPID BLOCK YOU IMBECAL, THIS TOTALLY FOLLOWS THE LAWS OF PHYSICS!!!), and annoying graphical bugs.Pros/Cons+Rewarding Building asthetics+Combat+Steam Workshop implementation (Sorta)+Nice Cartoon Graphics-Clunky AI-Horrible Physics-Minor Graphical BugsWhile there are quite a few problems, you have to remember that this is an early access game, and the developers are still actively working on it. I have had lots of fun playing this game, i would give it a 8/10, Would have all my workers fall off the edge of the floating island trying to chase the logs that rolled off.

content:
Posted: April 7
Early Access Review
								Such a simple game with such a broad array of things to do. That's how I see this great game. You protect a centre crystal as the main goal of the game, but I presume you figured that one out by now. Currently there are three types of bricktrons (aka characters) you can make which include workers, knights and archers which blend perfectly to protect your little castle.It's surprising how creative you can be using all of the building options availible (there's a lot) by digging into the hills and valleys around you, building walkways from each archer tower to another and building walls Trump couldn't even dream of. The game runs really well, it's cheap and the devs at Sauropod Studios keep the community up to date with what's going on, constantly adding new things and smashing the few little bugs which are never a problem but more of a funny part of the game which makes it what it is. With the recent addition of the workshop and the up coming 0.9 update the game is only getting better so get it before it comes out of early access!

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								The game, although simple, has enough content to make $20 a reasonable price.There's block by block castle building, survival, and if you convince a friend to get it you can play against one another.If you like easy, relaxed RTS games then I recommend this game. However, If you're looking for a hardcore, fully fleshed out, serious RTS then I'd recommend something else.All in all, the game may be simple, but keep in mind that it is a work in progress and the developers are working hard to make a $20 game have $60 worth of content.
