content:
Posted: October 3, 2016
Early Access Review
								I feel like this game needs all the positive games it can get. so i posted a review:When I first found the game in store, it looked really REALLY cool. But due to all its negative reviews i decided not to buy it. Three years later i checked the store to see how the game was doing. It had bugfixes and new enemies! But the reviews were still negative, but i decided to bite the bullet and purchase the game.the thing was. There was no bullet to bite! The game runs perfectly on my gaming computer and it runs fine on my laptop. So I wondered. Why were the reviews were so negative. the game runs fine so the only thing i could think that something was "worth" complaining about was the tutorial or the fact the game has been in beta for 3 years. I am a programer myself and coding something that allows you to control ai and make them place individual blocks to form a structure would be VERY challenging. And beleive it or not over half of the reviews were based off the fact that the game is in beta after 3 years. And listen people 3 years is litteraly the past NOW the game is great NOW for you strategy loving people. For those of you who having nothing to complain about: get over it. it's your fault for purchasing that game that was probably going to take a long time to devolop any way, do research before you buy a game.Game is great Sauropod keep up the great work.  Just make the tutorial better :).

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I really want to like this game, I really do... But there are so many issues that hold it back. Survival mode is a biut too hectic You can't really establish good fortifications because the waves come to quickly. I'm all for pressure but the waves come to fast.  Next, the unit responce is super lagged. I can't keep my warriors from engaging the big enemies because each time i give a comand to move they stop and attack...   If you kite mobs around a group of archers it seems like half the time the archers don't attack... The hole this is just clunky. I really hope they can streamline it a bit and make it fun. because I want to make a custom keep and defend it... but you can never get to the point to have a nice castle.   If they could add survival as a component to sandbox that would be nice. Like build a castle and see how many enemies it can fend off.Anyway thats just my opinion so far at version 0.5

content:
Posted: June 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is dead.  Its promised blend of building and strategy looked great, but no doubt the rotting corpse of this one will join the towering pile of unfinished sandbox games that will be Steam's legacy in the genre.For some, Early Access has come to mean "take the money and run".  I don't think that is the case here.  This game's history has followed the theme "we bit off more than we could chew, and made promises we couldn't keep."  After nearly TWO YEARS, the game has progressed hardly at all, and is only marginally more playable than it was several patches ago.  Perhaps it will be finished one fine day, but it would be foolish to wager money on the proposition at this point.The game features a team of tiny yellow people that follow your orders, which involve mainly gathering supplies, building simple bock structures, and defending those structures. The problems with the game are simple.* The pathfinding is strange and sometimes fails, getting your minion stuck somewhere between where they started and where you told them to go. Sometimes this leads to looping behavior. Pathfinding problems increase exponentially if you create structures of any non-trivial complexity. Creating systems of stairs and layers of fortifications eventually causes your minions to freeze and become useless.* The game has virtually no content. You can chop trees and mine, and build blocks. You can build a few very basic structures, which are periodically attacked by roving bad guys. The enemies are uniform and boring. Terrain is unrelieved grass and identical trees.

								The game itself looked promising when I first saw it on steam, which was around the time of release. I played it for a small bit back then and thought it had great potential. I recently came back to it to see if it has improved and so far not much that I have seen is actually new or innovative. The game still looks promising, but in its current state it doesn't seem like a game to purchase to play outright, only to support. Just my opinion of it; wait a bit for it to improve and grow as this does seem like a good game in the future.

Early Access Review
								A good idea, with a lot of potential. And then a minor amount of game, that qualifies as a 'tech demo'. Of course, it takes time to make a game, and early access games can start close to the pre-alpha state, but this is quite bare.However, this game has been 'released' as early access over two years ago, after being in development (Kickstarter) for a year before that. Actually; the Kickstarter backers should sue.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is awesome! If you like dwarf fortress but its too complicated for you or you just don't like to play ascii, this is a very good alternative! This game also features multiplayer, so you can finally show who's the better dwarf man to your friends!It's like a version of DF for kids because of the art style. Even though the games are very different in terms of mechanics, in terms of feel they are pretty much the same. You've got your dwarves Bricktrons, the building blocks, the catapults, and much more things that you will most likely find back in dwarf fortress. It is a very "game" centric game compared to DF because you do much more in terms of fighting and less in terms of managing, making sure everyone is not missing their sock(s) etc.Even not compared to DF this is a very fun game where you get to create your own castle and play a medival style game.I got this game a while ago and patiently waited for the dev's to update the game, I am not dissapointed. Even though it's updated pretty slowly, it is getting updated, and to me, that's what matters.

number of helpful: 9 of 21 people (43%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Though it is in Early Access, this game is fantastic! You are able to implement your own designs in the game to make the castle the way you want it. It is easy to learn, and fun to play. I honestly cannot wait for the full release of this game because, though it may take them a wee bit to update, the content they add in when they do is brilliant! What i would like to see fixed however, is the invisible blocks that force you to build around them after you've destroyed the blocks that were there. But, overall, i love cute little bundles of joy, i love designing my own castle, and i love the feel of this game. 9/10 for me at the moment :)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								Alright, so here is probably going to be my longest review, TL;DR Dont listen to those negitive reviews about slow development and game breaking bugs. The development LOOKS slow, but its also picked up in pace, its just that they are relasing in bigger chuncks and never really any small stuffs.Going to keep editing this review to keep it currentOn to the main review!Very, VERY good game and getting better. My ONLY issue with it is that currently multithreading is not supported, but soon they will work on that. And all their promises are coming, just not instantly, gotta have patience. That means in later rounds you start suffering lag. No matter, wait a year or so and then multithreading will be availible.Building castles here is very fun indeed. Other games like stronghold crusader 2 do a poor job at it and don't require much strategy. Stronghold 2 does it better, but nevertheless you are still limited, prefabs only for towers and such. Here, you can build a half wall half tower like thing that is nearly impossible to capture due to super clever designs and such. Making it hard to get to the other side of the wall is easy, making it hard to capture the top of the wall is hard, but dooable. Fun to watch my enemies (Other players sometimes :D ) send in 10 times as many men to assault my walls, but find themselves in a kill pit with my archers above them raining arrows down :D

								I enjoy playing castle story, however as with many other early access games there is still work to be done. The survival mode gameplay has the potential to be really fun however at the moment it becomes repetitive very quickly, The game itself looks nice and is complemented by a decent soundtrack. When you consider it is early access i'd reccomend picking it up now/when its on sale, playing it for 2/3 hours and then leave it until more updates are made.Pros -Nice ConceptEasy to use build systemVisuals and Audio Cons -Lacks hours of gameplayLack of choice when building6/10 but could be a 7/8 when released as a full game.

content:

Early Access Review
								I don't understand the complaints about this game; people say the developers don't stay in contact or update but they do more than any other developer I know of?The developers email out updates very often, and appear to be committed for the long haul (they're been refactoring some core code for quite some time, which just goes to show they want to do this right). The game has only got better since I backed the kickstarter, and shows no signs of stopping.There are bugs, but they are clearly being worked on, after all that's what early access is all about! In its current state, I don't think the game is worth £14.99, but I think it will definitely be once it's finished.Keep up the good work Sauropod!

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								It's evident the game isn't complete. It's evident that it can be tedious at times. This is my fourth time playing this game. The first three times barely covered two hours of game time. I was frustrated by the setup, aggravated with the lack of a tutorial and generally regretting buying this game.I decided to load it up tonight and jumped into Survival Mode. I know. Suicidal idea, given I suck on sandbox, right? Well surprisingly, I actually pick up the game better. I fail the first time and restart. This time, I was able to create a working base. For the first 15 waves or so I'm barely holding on, even getting down to three workers at one point. Then, I start using what I learned from playing around, and now I'm actually sending out soldiers outside the three walls and started to push them back. I had to admit, I was pleased with my progress...Less pleased that it's now 4:30 AM and I finally realize "I should probably stop playing now". I played for five hours straight, more than twice my first three playthroughs.TLDR: There's problems with the game. As expected, given it's early access. It's a bit of a learning curve. However, if you can beat the curve and get yourself organized, you're in for a treat, especially if you're into the micromanagement aspect. There are a few bugs (I get really ticked when trying to get my guys not to build parts before they can finish the rest of a section; sometimes they get cut off when they do). I'm of the hope as they work on the game, those bugs will be ironed out. Regardless, I'm giving this another shot and I'm hopeful that this time, I can get into it better.

								I really recomend this game for its advanced gameplay mechanics and the gameplay itself! have little yellow workers build your own castle on a series of floating islands! who doesn't want to do that? also, the fact that you can choose to be able to break your landscape and live free of any enemies, or you can choose to be unable to dig, and live in fear of the evil corruptrons, of which you can choose to huddle in your castle and hope they dont completely destroy you, or fight back and take a stand! content:

								Still in Alpha but it is a lot of fun to play. You lay out the blueprints for stuctures that your Bricktrons build using the resources that they farm. On Survival you defend against waves of baddies and in Sandbox you just build without worry. There are some pathing bugs and such but nothing that is a deal breaker as I have had worse on full versions. I really enjoy it and boot it up regularly.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								Castle story is a really good game, I love the building aspect of it the most because it really puts your mind to the test to find the best fortification. As this game is still unfinished I can see a lot of potential for story and future gameplay options.This game is like a combination of Minecraft, Tower Defense and a building simulator, and it is that combination that really drew me to it, I have always been a fan of lego, minecraft and anything where I can build freely, I also love to be able to build structures and see how much they can take before giving in.As for gameplay mechanics, the camera adjustment in game was a little tough to get used to at first, but I got used to it relatively fast, the graphics are smooth and lighting is really nice, there have been some issues with the characters in game not responding to a command every now and then and that has resulted in a few deaths, but that was a rare occurance.my final thoughts are if you like minecraft, lego, defence games or if you want to try something new and cool then get this game, you can't go wrong.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Okay to the reveiwers comparing this game to other game companies. This is Sauropods first game! Do not compare it to Introversion, they have made several games before and know how game coding works. When you have a new company, like Sauropod, its hard to get out of the starting gate. As being their first game, i expected long overdue updates, and this game is starting to go in a direction they need it to go. Yes, the AI are still dumb as bricks, even in the new update. but the Sauropod team are doing there best, so cut them some slack and stop comparing them to other companies that have many games released. I find myself coming back because this game is special to me, it has a certain mechanic i like. I like watching my archers stand on towers while shooting death down to my enemies. I purposely build a tower the wrong way just to see it fall to see how the physics engine runs. This game is really fun to play, we just have to keep our minds open to what we are playing. As for me i am standing by this game and its' developers and i hope for even better content in the future! Keep going Sauropod!

								Castle story is a really good game, I love the building aspect of it the most because it really puts your mind to the test to find the best fortification. As this game is still unfinished I can see a lot of potential for story and future gameplay options.This game is like a combination of Minecraft, Tower Defense and a building simulator, and it is that combination that really drew me to it, I have always been a fan of lego, minecraft and anything where I can build freely, I also love to be able to build structures and see how much they can take before giving in.As for gameplay mechanics, the camera adjustment in game was a little tough to get used to at first, but I got used to it relatively fast, the graphics are smooth and lighting is really nice, there have been some issues with the characters in game not responding to a command every now and then and that has resulted in a few deaths, but that was a rare occurance.my final thoughts are if you like minecraft, lego, defence games or if you want to try something new and cool then get this game, you can't go wrong.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								Before I start, don't let my play time fool you.  I purchased and played Castle Story long before I got a Steam key for it.  It seems updates hit Steam before anywhere else (for most indie games) so I like to grab the Steam keys for my early access games whenever I can.That said, let's talk about Castle Story!  It's full of bugs, saves go corrupt once in a while, and you'll pull your hair out sometimes trying to figure out why the hell your guys aren't doing what you tell them.  Sounds bad eh?  It isn't...Aside from the bugs, which should be expected in any early access game, Castle Story is a solid game that brings you everything it promises.  The developers are very active and seem to care about wanting to both improve and finish the game, which is always a risk when you’re talking early access.  The game itself can be a little frustrating at times.  At the moment the AI system is pretty broken.  This can leave your little yellow guys sometimes sitting around picking their noses, even though you just told them to do something.  The mess is simply due to the poor way the AI was initially designed.  That said, the developers are working on a complete rebuild of the AI system so we’ll definitely see improvements in this department soon.Construction in this game is pretty lacking, but you don’t notice it.  You’ve got about 5 different blocks your people can use to build walls and structures with and that’s all you really need.  I’ve had some really good “castle” builds with just those basic blocks.  I have every reason to expect them to add a few more blocks to the game, like maybe some angled ones, but you don’t really miss having them when you’re playing.  The pre-construction “blueprint” style of building is also extremely useful.  You can plan out your structures before you even lay the first brick, or change the design on the fly.The biggest frustration I have with the game, aside from the broken AI, is the falling trees.  I absolutely love how they have trees incorporated.  They get cut down, fall over, break into logs, but then it all goes wrong...  Most trees grow on the edges of the islands (floating in the sky) and when you cut a tree you have about a 99% chance that tree is going to fall toward the edge and all your logs fall into nothingness.  The only way to stop this is to go through the very resource intensive and time consuming process of building a wall around the trees so they can’t fall off the island when cut down.  In addition, trees cannot (as far as I know) be replanted currently, so once you clear an island that’s all the wood you have.  Any wasted wood, from falling off the island, is gone for good.The audio in the game is ok.  It’s not going to be winning any awards, but it’s not bad either.  I would have liked a little bit more of an audio track.  That said, you don’t really miss it.Castle Story is one of those games that you might not obsessively play, but you’ll keep going back to just the same.  Why?  Because it’s a fun casual building game that doesn’t really require a lot of concentration.  It’s not for everyone, but I highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys building Castles with a little “tower defense” thrown in.
